arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو خَالِدٍ الْأَحْمَرُ عَنْ دَاوُدَ، عَنْ أَبِي نَضْرَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي سَعِيدٍ، قَالَ: لَمَّا رَجَعَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ مِنْ تَبُوكَ سَأَلُوهُ عَنِ السَّاعَةِ فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: لَا تَأْتِي مِائَةُ سَنَةٍ وَعَلَى الْأَرْضِ نَفْسٌ مَنْفُوسَةٌ الْيَوْمَ
english_text: Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar narrated from Dawud, from Abu Nadrah, from Abu Sa'id, who said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) returned from Tabuk, they asked him about the Hour. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "One hundred years will not come to pass while there is a breathing soul on the earth today."
narrators_ar: أَبُو خَالِدٍ الْأَحْمَرُ، دَاوُدَ، أَبِي نَضْرَةَ، أَبِي سَعِيدٍ
narrators_en: Abu Khalid Al-Ahmar, Dawud, Abu Nadrah, Abu Sa'id

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا ابْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ عَنِ الزُّهْرِيِّ، عَنْ أَنَسٍ، قَالَ: سَأَلَ رَجُلٌ النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: مَتَى السَّاعَةُ؟ فَقَالَ: مَا أَعْدَدْتَ لَهَا؟ فَلَمْ يَذْكُرْ شَيْئًا إِلَّا أَنِّي أُحِبُّ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ , فَقَالَ: الْمَرْءُ مَعَ مَنْ أَحَبَّ
english_text: Ibn Uyainah narrated from Az-Zuhri, from Anas, who said: A man asked the Prophet (peace be upon him): "When is the Hour?" He said: "What have you prepared for it?" He did not mention anything except: "I love Allah and His Messenger." He said: "A person is with whom he loves."
narrators_ar: ابْنُ عُيَيْنَةَ، الزُّهْرِيِّ، أَنَسٍ
narrators_en: Ibn Uyainah, Az-Zuhri, Anas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، عَنْ شِمْرٍ، عَنْ أَبِي يَحْيَى، عَنْ كَعْبٍ، قَالَ: لَا تَقُومُ السَّاعَةُ حَتَّى يَكُونَ الرَّجُلُ الْوَاحِدُ قَيِّمَ خَمْسِينَ امْرَأَةً
english_text: Abu Bakr said: Waki narrated to us, from Al-A'mash, from Shimr, from Abu Yahya, from Ka'b, who said: "The Hour will not be established until one man is the guardian of fifty women."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ، وَكِيعٌ، الْأَعْمَشِ، شِمْرٍ، أَبِي يَحْيَى، كَعْبٍ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr, Waki, Al-A'mash, Shimr, Abu Yahya, Ka'b

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ قَالَ أَخْبَرَنَا سُلَيْمَانُ التَّيْمِيُّ، عَنْ أَبِي نَضْرَةَ، عَنْ جَابِرٍ، أَنَّ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ قَالَ: مَا مِنْكُمْ مِنْ نَفْسٍ مَنْفُوسَةٍ تَأْتِي عَلَيْهَا مِائَةُ سَنَةٍ وَهِيَ حَيَّةٌ يَوْمَئِذٍ
english_text: Yazid bin Harun narrated, saying: Sulaiman At-Taimi informed us, from Abu Nadrah, from Jabir, that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "There is no breathing soul among you upon whom one hundred years will come while it is alive on that day."
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، سُلَيْمَانُ التَّيْمِيُّ، أَبِي نَضْرَةَ، جَابِرٍ
narrators_en: Yazid bin Harun, Sulaiman At-Taimi, Abu Nadrah, Jabir

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ التَّيْمِيِّ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، صَاحِبِ السِّقَايَةِ، عَنْ جَابِرٍ، عَنِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ مِثْلُهُ , وَفَسَّرَ جَابِرٌ: نُقْصَانٌ مِنَ الْعُمْرِ
english_text: Yazid narrated from Sulaiman At-Taimi, from Abdur-Rahman, the owner of the Siqayah, from Jabir, from the Prophet (peace be upon him) something similar. And Jabir explained: "A decrease in lifespan."
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ، سُلَيْمَانَ التَّيْمِيِّ، عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ، جَابِرٍ
narrators_en: Yazid, Sulaiman At-Taimi, Abdur-Rahman, Jabir

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا جَرِيرٌ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ بْنِ رُفَيْعٍ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ اللَّيْثِيِّ، قَالَ: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: لَا تَقُومُ السَّاعَةُ حَتَّى يَخْرُجَ ثَلَاثُونَ كَذَّابًا، كُلُّهُمْ يَزْعُمُ أَنَّهُ نَبِيٌّ قَبْلَ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ
english_text: Jarir narrated from Abdul-Aziz bin Rufai', from Ubaid bin Umair Al-Laithi, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The Hour will not be established until thirty liars emerge, all of them claiming to be a prophet before the Day of Resurrection."
narrators_ar: جَرِيرٌ، عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ بْنِ رُفَيْعٍ، عُبَيْدِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ اللَّيْثِيِّ
narrators_en: Jarir, Abdul-Aziz bin Rufai', Ubaid bin Umair Al-Laithi

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ عَنْ سِمَاكٍ، عَنْ جَابِرِ بْنِ سَمُرَةَ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ يَقُولُ: إِنَّ بَيْنَ يَدَيِ السَّاعَةِ كَذَّابِينَ , فَقُلْتُ: أَنْتَ سَمِعْتُهُ مِنْ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ؟ قَالَ: نَعَمْ
english_text: Abu Al-Ahwas narrated from Simak, from Jabir bin Samurah, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: "Indeed, before the Hour there will be liars." I said: "Did you hear it from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)?" He said: "Yes."
narrators_ar: أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ، سِمَاكٍ، جَابِرِ بْنِ سَمُرَةَ
narrators_en: Abu Al-Ahwas, Simak, Jabir bin Samurah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ قَالَ أَخْبَرَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَمْرٍو، عَنْ أَبِي سَلَمَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، قَالَ: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: لَا تَقُومُ السَّاعَةُ حَتَّى يَخْرُجَ ثَلَاثُونَ كَذَّابًا دَجَّالًا يَكْذِبُ عَلَى اللَّهِ وَعَلَى رَسُولِهِ
english_text: Yazid bin Harun narrated, saying: Muhammad bin Amr informed us, from Abu Salamah, from Abu Hurairah, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The Hour will not be established until thirty liars, Dajjals, emerge, lying against Allah and His Messenger."
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَمْرٍو، أَبِي سَلَمَةَ، أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ
narrators_en: Yazid bin Harun, Muhammad bin Amr, Abu Salamah, Abu Hurairah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا الْفَضْلُ بْنُ دُكَيْنٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا بَدْرُ بْنُ عُثْمَانَ، قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا الشَّعْبِيُّ، عَنْ رَجُلٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مَسْعُودٍ، عَنْ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ أَنَّهُ قَالَ يَوْمًا: يَكُونُ فِي آخِرِ الزَّمَانِ أَرْبَعُ فِتَنٍ يَكُونُ فِي آخِرِهَا الْفَنَاءُ
english_text: Al-Fadl bin Dukain narrated, saying: Badr bin Uthman narrated to us, saying: Ash-Sha'bi informed us, from a man, from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) that he said one day: "In the end of times there will be four trials; in the last of them will be annihilation."
narrators_ar: الْفَضْلُ بْنُ دُكَيْنٍ، بَدْرُ بْنُ عُثْمَانَ، الشَّعْبِيِّ، رَجُلٍ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مَسْعُودٍ
narrators_en: Al-Fadl bin Dukain, Badr bin Uthman, Ash-Sha'bi, A man, Abdullah bin Mas'ud

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ جَابِرٍ، عَنْ عَامِرٍ، قَالَ: سُئِلَ حُذَيْفَةُ: أَيُّ الْفِتْنَةِ أَشَدُّ؟ قَالَ: أَنْ يُعْرَضَ عَلَيْكَ الْخَيْرُ وَالشَّرُّ لَا تَدْرِي أَيَّهُمَا تَتْبَعُ
english_text: Waki narrated from Sufyan, from Jabir, from Amir, who said: Hudhaifah was asked: "Which Fitnah (trial) is most severe?" He said: "That good and evil are presented to you and you do not know which of them to follow."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، جَابِرٍ، عَامِرٍ، حُذَيْفَةُ
narrators_en: Waki, Sufyan, Jabir, Amir, Hudhaifah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ رَجُلٍ، عَنِ الضَّحَّاكِ، عَنْ حُذَيْفَةَ، قَالَ: إِنَّ أَخْوَفُ مَا أَتَخَوَّفُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْ تُؤْثِرُوا مَا تَرَوْنَ عَلَى مَا تَعْلَمُونَ , وَأَنْ تَضِلُّوا وَأَنْتُمْ لَا تَشْعُرُونَ
english_text: Waki narrated from Sufyan, from a man, from Ad-Dahhak, from Hudhaifah, who said: "Indeed, what I fear most for you is that you prefer what you see over what you know, and that you go astray while you are unaware."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، رَجُلٍ، الضَّحَّاكِ، حُذَيْفَةَ
narrators_en: Waki, Sufyan, A man, Ad-Dahhak, Hudhaifah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنِ ابْنِ عَوْنٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سَعْدٍ، قَالَ: قَالَ عُمَرُ: أَخْوَفُ مَا أَتَخَوَّفُ عَلَى هَذِهِ الْأُمَّةِ قَوْمٌ يَتَأَوَّلُونَ الْقُرْآنَ عَلَى غَيْرِ تَأْوِيلِهِ
english_text: Waki narrated from Ibn Awn, from Abdullah bin Sa'd, who said: Umar said: "What I fear most for this Ummah are people who interpret the Quran in a way other than its [true] interpretation."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، ابْنِ عَوْنٍ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سَعْدٍ، عُمَرُ
narrators_en: Waki, Ibn Awn, Abdullah bin Sa'd, Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ عُبَيْدَةَ، عَنْ طَلْحَةَ بْنِ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ كَرِيزٍ، قَالَ: قَالَ عُمَرُ: إِنَّ أَخْوَفَ مَا أَتَخَوَّفُ عَلَيْكُمْ شُحٌّ مُطَاعٌ , وَهَوًى مُتَّبَعٌ , وَإِعْجَابُ الْمَرْءِ بِرَأْيِهِ , وَهِيَ أَشَدُّهُنَّ
english_text: Waki narrated from Musa bin Ubaidah, from Talhah bin Ubaidullah bin Kariz, who said: Umar said: "Indeed, what I fear most for you is stinginess that is obeyed, desire that is followed, and a person's admiration of his own opinion; and that is the most severe of them."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، مُوسَى بْنِ عُبَيْدَةَ، طَلْحَةَ بْنِ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ كَرِيزٍ، عُمَرُ
narrators_en: Waki, Musa bin Ubaidah, Talhah bin Ubaidullah bin Kariz, Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا كَثِيرُ بْنُ زَيْدٍ، عَنِ الْمُطَّلِبِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ حَنْطَبٍ، قَالَ: قَالَ "مَا أَتَخَوَّفُ عَلَيْكُمْ أَحَدُ رَجُلَيْنِ: مُؤْمِنٌ قَدِ اسْتَبَانَ إِيمَانُهُ , وَكَافِرٌ قَدْ تَبَيَّنَ كُفْرُهُ , وَلَكِنْ أَتَخَوَّفُ عَلَيْكُمْ مُتَعَوِّذًا بِالْإِيمَانِ يَعْمَلُ بِغَيْرِهِ
english_text: Waki narrated, saying: Kathir bin Zaid narrated to us, from Al-Muttalib bin Abdullah bin Hantab, who said: He said: "I do not fear for you either of two men: a believer whose faith is clear, and a disbeliever whose disbelief is evident. But I fear for you the one who seeks refuge in faith [outwardly] but acts by other than it."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، كَثِيرُ بْنُ زَيْدٍ، الْمُطَّلِبِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ حَنْطَبٍ
narrators_en: Waki, Kathir bin Zaid, Al-Muttalib bin Abdullah bin Hantab

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ وَاقِعِ بْنِ سَحْبَانَ، عَنْ طَرِيفِ بْنِ يَزِيدَ بْنِ طَرِيفٍ، عَنْ أَبِي مُوسَى، قَالَ: إِنَّ بَيْنَ يَدَيِ السَّاعَةِ أَيَّامًا يَنْزِلُ فِيهَا الْجَهْلُ، وَيُرْفَعُ فِيهَا الْعِلْمُ، حَتَّى يَقُومَ الرَّجُلُ إِلَى أُمِّهِ فَيَضْرِبُهَا بِالسَّيْفِ مِنَ الْجَهْلِ
english_text: Waki narrated from Shu'bah, from Qatadah, from Waqi' bin Sahban, from Tarif bin Yazid bin Tarif, from Abu Musa, who said: "Indeed, before the Hour there will be days in which ignorance descends and knowledge is lifted, until a man stands over his mother and strikes her with a sword out of ignorance."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، شُعْبَةَ، قَتَادَةَ، وَاقِعِ بْنِ سَحْبَانَ، طَرِيفِ بْنِ يَزِيدَ بْنِ طَرِيفٍ، أَبِي مُوسَى
narrators_en: Waki, Shu'bah, Qatadah, Waqi' bin Sahban, Tarif bin Yazid bin Tarif, Abu Musa

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ قَيْسٍ، عَنْ عَطِيَّةَ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، فِي قَوْلِهِ {وَإِذَا وَقَعَ الْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَخْرَجْنَا لَهُمْ دَابَّةً مِنَ الْأَرْضِ تُكَلِّمُهُمْ} [النمل: 82] قَالَ: حِينَ لَا يَأْمُرُونَ بِمَعْرُوفٍ، وَلَا يَنْهَوْنَ عَنْ مُنْكَرٍ
english_text: Waki narrated from Sufyan, from Amr bin Qais, from Atiyyah, from Ibn Umar, regarding His saying {And when the word befalls them, We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth speaking to them} [An-Naml: 82], he said: "When they do not enjoin good and do not forbid evil."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، عَمْرِو بْنِ قَيْسٍ، عَطِيَّةَ، ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Waki, Sufyan, Amr bin Qais, Atiyyah, Ibn Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ، عَنْ شَبِيبِ بْنِ غَرْقَدَةَ، عَنِ الْمُسْتَظِلِّ بْنِ حُصَيْنٍ، قَالَ: قَالَ عَلِيٌّ: يَا أَهْلَ الْكُوفَةِ، لَتَأْمُرُنَّ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ، وَلَتَنْهَوُنَّ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ، وَلَتَجِدُنَّ فِي أَمْرِ اللَّهِ، أَوْ لَيَسُومَنَّكُمْ أَقْوَامٌ يُعَذِّبُونَكُمْ وَيُعَذِّبُهُمُ اللَّهُ
english_text: Sharik narrated from Shabib bin Gharqadah, from Al-Mustazill bin Husain, who said: Ali said: "O people of Kufa, you must enjoin good and forbid evil, and you will find yourselves in the command of Allah, or else people will be imposed upon you who will torment you, and Allah will torment them."
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ، شَبِيبِ بْنِ غَرْقَدَةَ، الْمُسْتَظِلِّ بْنِ حُصَيْنٍ، عَلِيٌّ
narrators_en: Sharik, Shabib bin Gharqadah, Al-Mustazill bin Husain, Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ حَبِيبٍ، عَنْ أَبِي الطُّفَيْلِ، قَالَ قِيلَ لِحُذَيْفَةَ: مَا مَيِّتُ الْأَحْيَاءِ؟ قَالَ مَنْ لَمْ يَعْرِفِ الْمَعْرُوفَ بِقَلْبِهِ، وَيُنْكِرِ الْمُنْكَرَ بِقَلْبِهِ
english_text: Waki narrated from Sufyan, from Habib, from Abu At-Tufail, who said: It was said to Hudhaifah: "Who are the dead among the living?" He said: "He who does not recognize good with his heart, nor denies evil with his heart."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، حَبِيبٍ، أَبِي الطُّفَيْلِ، حُذَيْفَةَ
narrators_en: Waki, Sufyan, Habib, Abu At-Tufail, Hudhaifah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، عَنْ قَيْسِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ، عَنْ أَبِي جُحَيْفَةَ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ، قَالَ: إِنَّ أَوَّلَ مَا تُغْلَبُونَ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ الْجِهَادِ الْجِهَادُ بِأَيْدِيكُمْ، ثُمَّ الْجِهَادُ بِأَلْسِنَتِكُمْ، ثُمَّ الْجِهَادُ بِقُلُوبِكُمْ , فَأَيُّ قَلْبٍ لَمْ يَعْرِفِ الْمَعْرُوفَ، وَلَا يُنْكِرُ الْمُنْكَرَ، نُكِّسَ فَجُعِلَ أَعْلَاهُ أَسْفَلَهُ
english_text: Abu Mu'awiyah narrated from Al-A'mash, from Qais bin Rashid, from Abu Juhaifah, from Ali, who said: "The first Jihad you will be overcome in is Jihad with your hands, then Jihad with your tongues, then Jihad with your hearts. So any heart that does not recognize good and does not deny evil is overturned, so its top becomes its bottom."
narrators_ar: أَبُو مُعَاوِيَةَ، الْأَعْمَشِ، قَيْسِ بْنِ رَاشِدٍ، أَبِي جُحَيْفَةَ، عَلِيٍّ
narrators_en: Abu Mu'awiyah, Al-A'mash, Qais bin Rashid, Abu Juhaifah, Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ زُبَيْدٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، عَنْ أَبِي جُحَيْفَةَ، عَنْ عَلِيٍّ، قَالَ: فَيُنَكَّسُ كَمَا يُنَكَّسُ الْجِرَابُ فَيُنْثَرُ مَا فِيهِ
english_text: Waki narrated from Sufyan, from Zubaid, from Ash-Sha'bi, from Abu Juhaifah, from Ali, who said: "So it is overturned just as a bag is overturned and what is in it is scattered."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، زُبَيْدٍ، الشَّعْبِيِّ، أَبِي جُحَيْفَةَ، عَلِيٍّ
narrators_en: Waki, Sufyan, Zubaid, Ash-Sha'bi, Abu Juhaifah, Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَرِيكٌ عَنْ سِمَاكٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ، عَنْ زَوْجِ دُرَّةَ، عَنْ دُرَّةَ، قَالَتْ: دَخَلْتُ عَلَى النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ وَهُوَ فِي الْمَسْجِدِ فَقُلْتُ: "مَنْ أَتْقَى النَّاسِ؟ قَالَ: آمَرُهُمْ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ، وَأَنْهَاهُمْ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ، وَأَوْصَلُهُمْ لِلرَّحِمِ
english_text: Sharik narrated from Simak, from Abdullah bin Amirah, from the husband of Durrah, from Durrah, who said: I entered upon the Prophet (peace be upon him) while he was in the mosque and said: "Who are the most pious of people?" He said: "Those who enjoin them to good, forbid them from evil, and join ties of kinship the most."
narrators_ar: شَرِيكٌ، سِمَاكٍ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ، زَوْجِ دُرَّةَ، دُرَّةَ
narrators_en: Sharik, Simak, Abdullah bin Amirah, Husband of Durrah, Durrah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ قَيْسِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ، عَنْ طَارِقِ بْنِ شِهَابٍ، قَالَ قَالَ: رَجُلٌ لِعَبْدِ اللَّهِ: هَلَكَ مَنْ لَمْ يَأْمُرْ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَلَمْ يَنْهَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ، فَقَالَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بَلْ هَلَكَ مَنْ لَمْ يَعْرِفِ الْمَعْرُوفَ بِقَلْبِهِ، وَيُنْكِرِ الْمُنْكَرَ بِقَلْبِهِ
english_text: Waki narrated from Sufyan, from Qais bin Muslim, from Tariq bin Shihab, who said: A man said to Abdullah: "He who does not enjoin good and does not forbid evil is destroyed." Abdullah said: "Rather, he is destroyed who does not recognize good with his heart and deny evil with his heart."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، قَيْسِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ، طَارِقِ بْنِ شِهَابٍ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ
narrators_en: Waki, Sufyan, Qais bin Muslim, Tariq bin Shihab, Abdullah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا جَرِيرٌ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ، عَنِ الرَّبِيعِ بْنِ عُمَيْلَةَ، قَالَ: قَالَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ: إِنَّهَا سَتَكُونُ هَنَاتٌ وَهَنَاتٌ , فَبِحَسْبِ امْرِئٍ إِذَا رَأَى مُنْكَرًا لَا يَسْتَطِيعُ لَهُ تَغْيِيرًا يَعْلَمُ اللَّهُ مِنْ قَلْبِهِ أَنَّهُ لَهُ كَارِهٌ
english_text: Jarir narrated from Abdul-Malik bin Umair, from Ar-Rabi' bin Umailah, who said: Abdullah said: "There will be tribulations and tribulations. It is sufficient for a person, if he sees an evil he cannot change, that Allah knows from his heart that he dislikes it."
narrators_ar: جَرِيرٌ، عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ، الرَّبِيعِ بْنِ عُمَيْلَةَ، عَبْدُ اللَّهِ
narrators_en: Jarir, Abdul-Malik bin Umair, Ar-Rabi' bin Umailah, Abdullah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ نُمَيْرٍ، وَأَبُو أُسَامَةَ قَالَا: حَدَّثَنَا إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ أَبِي خَالِدٍ، عَنْ قَيْسِ بْنِ أَبِي حَازِمٍ، قَالَ: قَامَ أَبُو بَكْرٍ فَحَمِدَ اللَّهَ وَأَثْنَى عَلَيْهِ ثُمَّ قَالَ: يَا أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ , إِنَّكُمْ تَقْرَءُونَ هَذِهِ الْآيَةَ: {يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا عَلَيْكُمْ أَنْفُسَكُمْ لَا يَضُرُّكُمْ مَنْ ضَلَّ إِذَا اهْتَدَيْتُمْ} [المائدة: 105] وَإِنَّا سَمِعْنَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ - يَقُولُ: إِنَّ النَّاسَ إِذَا رَأَوَا الْمُنْكَرَ لَا يُغَيِّرُونَهُ أَوْشَكَ اللَّهُ أَنْ يَعُمَّهُمْ بِعِقَابِهِ , قَالَ أَبُو أُسَامَةَ: وَقَالَ مَرَّةً أُخْرَى: وَأَنَا سَمِعْتُ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ يَقُولُ
english_text: Abdullah bin Numair and Abu Usamah said: Isma'il bin Abi Khalid narrated to us, from Qais bin Abi Hazim, who said: Abu Bakr stood up, praised Allah and extolled Him, then said: "O people, you recite this verse: {O you who have believed, upon you is [responsibility for] yourselves. Those who have gone astray will not harm you when you have been guided} [Al-Ma'idah: 105]. And indeed we heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: 'Indeed, if people see evil and do not change it, Allah is likely to encompass them all with His punishment.'" Abu Usamah said: And he said another time: "And I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say..."
narrators_ar: عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ نُمَيْرٍ، أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، إِسْمَاعِيلُ بْنُ أَبِي خَالِدٍ، قَيْسِ بْنِ أَبِي حَازِمٍ، أَبُو بَكْرٍ
narrators_en: Abdullah bin Numair, Abu Usamah, Isma'il bin Abi Khalid, Qais bin Abi Hazim, Abu Bakr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا جَرِيرٌ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ بْنِ رُفَيْعٍ، عَنْ شَدَّادِ بْنِ مَعْقِلٍ، قَالَ: قَالَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ: يُوشِكُ أَنْ لَا تَأْخُذُوا مِنَ الْكُوفَةِ نَقْدًا وَلَا دِرْهَمًا , قُلْتُ: وَكَيْفَ يَا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ بْنَ مَسْعُودٍ؟ قَالَ: يَجِيءُ قَوْمٌ كَأَنَّ وُجُوهَهُمُ الْمَجَانُّ الْمُطْرَقَةُ حَتَّى يَرْبِطُوا خُيُولَهُمْ عَلَى السَّوَاءِ فَيُجْلُوكُمْ إِلَى مَنَابِتِ الشِّيحِ حَتَّى يَكُونَ الْبَعِيرُ وَالزَّادُ أَحَبَّ إِلَى أَحَدِكُمْ مِنَ الْقَصْرِ مِنْ قُصُورِكُمْ هَذِهِ
english_text: Jarir narrated from Abdul-Aziz bin Rufai', from Shaddad bin Ma'qil, who said: Abdullah said: "You will soon take neither cash nor dirham from Kufa." I said: "How is that, O Abdullah bin Mas'ud?" He said: "A people will come whose faces are like hammered shields, until they tether their horses at As-Sawad, and they will expel you to the places where wormwood grows, until a camel and provisions will be more beloved to one of you than a palace among these palaces of yours."
narrators_ar: جَرِيرٌ، عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ بْنِ رُفَيْعٍ، شَدَّادِ بْنِ مَعْقِلٍ، عَبْدُ اللَّهِ
narrators_en: Jarir, Abdul-Aziz bin Rufai', Shaddad bin Ma'qil, Abdullah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ عَنْ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ بْنِ رُفَيْعٍ، عَنْ شَدَّادِ بْنِ مَعْقِلٍ الْأَسَدِيِّ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ ابْنَ مَسْعُودٍ، يَقُولُ: أَوَّلُ مَا تَفْقِدُونَ مِنْ دِينِكُمُ الْأَمَانَةُ , وَآخِرُ مَا تَفْقِدُونَ مِنْهُ الصَّلَاةُ , وَسَيُصَلِّي قَوْمٌ وَلَا دِينَ لَهُمْ , وَإِنَّ هَذَا الْقُرْآنَ الَّذِي بَيْنَ أَظْهُرِكُمْ كَأَنَّهُ قَدْ نُزِعَ مِنْكُمْ , قَالَ: قُلْتُ: كَيْفَ يَا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ , وَقَدْ أَثْبَتَهُ اللَّهُ فِي قُلُوبِنَا؟ قَالَ: "يَسْرِي عَلَيْهِ فِي لَيْلَةٍ فَتُرْفَعُ الْمَصَاحِفُ، وَيُنْزَعُ مَا فِي الْقُلُوبِ , ثُمَّ تَلَا {وَلَئِنْ شِئْنَا لَنَذْهَبَنَّ بِالَّذِي أَوْحَيْنَا إِلَيْكَ} [الإسراء: 86] " إِلَى آخِرِ الْآيَةِ
english_text: Abu Al-Ahwas narrated from Abdul-Aziz bin Rufai', from Shaddad bin Ma'qil Al-Asadi, who said: I heard Ibn Mas'ud say: "The first thing you will lose of your religion is trustworthiness (Amanah), and the last thing you will lose of it is prayer. A people will pray who have no religion. And this Quran which is among you will be as if it has been stripped from you." He said: I said: "How, O Abdullah, when Allah has established it in our hearts?" He said: "It will be taken away in a night, the Mus-hafs will be lifted, and what is in the hearts will be stripped away." Then he recited: {And if We willed, We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you} [Al-Isra: 86] to the end of the verse.
narrators_ar: أَبُو الْأَحْوَصِ، عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ بْنِ رُفَيْعٍ، شَدَّادِ بْنِ مَعْقِلٍ الْأَسَدِيِّ، ابْنَ مَسْعُودٍ
narrators_en: Abu Al-Ahwas, Abdul-Aziz bin Rufai', Shaddad bin Ma'qil Al-Asadi, Ibn Mas'ud

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا فُضَيْلُ بْنُ عِيَاضٍ عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، عَنْ خَيْثَمَةَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، قَالَ: يَأْتِي عَلَى النَّاسِ زَمَانٌ يَجْتَمِعُونَ وَيُصَلُّونَ فِي الْمَسَاجِدِ وَلَيْسَ فِيهِمْ مُؤْمِنٌ
english_text: Fudail bin Iyad narrated from Al-A'mash, from Khaithamah, from Abdullah bin Amr, who said: "A time will come upon the people when they gather and pray in the mosques, yet there is not a believer among them."
narrators_ar: فُضَيْلُ بْنُ عِيَاضٍ، الْأَعْمَشِ، خَيْثَمَةَ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو
narrators_en: Fudail bin Iyad, Al-A'mash, Khaithamah, Abdullah bin Amr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا زَكَرِيَّا، عَنْ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، عَنْ أَبِي الْعَالِيَةِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سَلَمَةَ الْهَمْدَانِيِّ، عَنْ أَبِي مَيْسَرَةَ، قَالَ: تَبْقَى رَجْرَجَةٌ مِنَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْرِفُونَ حَقًّا وَلَا يُنْكِرُونَ مُنْكَرًا يَتَرَاكَبُونَ تَرَاكُبَ الدَّوَابِّ وَالْأَنْعَامِ
english_text: Abu Usamah narrated to us, saying: Zakariyya narrated to us, from Abu Ishaq, from Abu Al-Aliyah Abdullah bin Salamah Al-Hamdani, from Abu Maisarah, who said: "There will remain a rabble of people who do not recognize truth nor deny evil, mounting one another like beasts and cattle."
narrators_ar: أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، زَكَرِيَّا، أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، أَبِي الْعَالِيَةِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ سَلَمَةَ الْهَمْدَانِيِّ، أَبِي مَيْسَرَةَ
narrators_en: Abu Usamah, Zakariyya, Abu Ishaq, Abu Al-Aliyah Abdullah bin Salamah Al-Hamdani, Abu Maisarah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ عَنْ مُجَالِدٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، قَالَ: لَا تَقُومُ السَّاعَةُ حَتَّى يَصِيرَ الْعِلْمُ جَهْلًا وَالْجَهْلُ عِلْمًا
english_text: Abu Usamah narrated from Mujalid, from Ash-Sha'bi, who said: "The Hour will not be established until knowledge becomes ignorance and ignorance becomes knowledge."
narrators_ar: أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، مُجَالِدٍ، الشَّعْبِيِّ
narrators_en: Abu Usamah, Mujalid, Ash-Sha'bi

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بُرْقَانَ، عَنْ يَزِيدَ بْنِ الْأَصَمِّ، عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، قَالَ: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: تَكْثُرُ الْفِتَنُ وَيَكْثُرُ الْهَرْجُ قُلْنَا: وَمَا الْهَرْجُ؟ قَالَ: الْقَتْلُ، وَيَنْقُصُ الْعِلْمُ , قَالَ: أَمَا إِنَّهُ لَيْسَ يُنْزَعُ مِنْ صُدُورِ الرِّجَالِ , وَلَكِنْ يُقْبَضُ الْعُلَمَاءُ
english_text: Waki narrated from Ja'far bin Burqan, from Yazid bin Al-Asamm, from Abu Hurairah, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Tribulations will increase and Harj will increase." We said: "What is Harj?" He said: "Killing. And knowledge will decrease." He said: "Indeed, it is not stripped from the hearts of men, but the scholars are taken away."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بُرْقَانَ، يَزِيدَ بْنِ الْأَصَمِّ، أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ
narrators_en: Waki, Ja'far bin Burqan, Yazid bin Al-Asamm, Abu Hurairah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، قَالَ: قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَقْبِضُ الْعِلْمَ انْتِزَاعًا يَنْزِعُهُ مِنَ النَّاسِ , وَلَكِنْ يَقْبِضُ الْعِلْمَ بِقَبْضِ الْعُلَمَاءِ حَتَّى إِذَا لَمْ يَبْقَ عَالِمٌ اتَّخَذَ النَّاسُ رُؤَسَاءَ جُهَّالًا فَسُئِلُوا فَأَفْتَوْا بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍ فَضَلُّوا وَأَضَلُّوا
english_text: Abu Bakr said: Waki narrated to us, from Hisham, from his father, from Abdullah bin Amr, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Allah does not take away knowledge by snatching it from the people, but He takes away knowledge by taking away the scholars, until when no scholar remains, people take ignorant leaders who are asked and give Fatwas without knowledge, thus going astray and leading others astray."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ، وَكِيعٌ، هِشَامٍ، أَبِيهِ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو
narrators_en: Abu Bakr, Waki, Hisham, His Father, Abdullah bin Amr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ مِسْعَرٍ، عَنْ وَبَرَةَ، عَنْ خَرَشَةَ بْنِ الْحُرِّ، قَالَ: قَالَ عُمَرُ: تَهْلَكُ الْعَرَبُ حِينَ تَبْلُغُ أَنْبَاءُ بَنَاتِ فَارِسَ
english_text: Waki narrated from Mis'ar, from Wabarah, from Kharashah bin Al-Hurr, who said: Umar said: "The Arabs will perish when the sons of the daughters of Persia grow up among them."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، مِسْعَرٍ، وَبَرَةَ، خَرَشَةَ بْنِ الْحُرِّ، عُمَرُ
narrators_en: Waki, Mis'ar, Wabarah, Kharashah bin Al-Hurr, Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ هِشَامٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، قَالَ: لَمْ يَزَلْ أَمْرُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ مُعْتَدِلًا حَتَّى نَشَأَ فِيهِمْ أَبْنَاءُ سَبَايَا الْأُمَمِ , فَقَالُوا فِيهِمْ بِالرَّأْيِ فَضَلُّوا وَأَضَلُّوا
english_text: Waki narrated from Hisham, from his father, from Abdullah bin Amr, who said: "The affair of the Children of Israel remained moderate until the sons of the captives of the nations grew up among them. They spoke among them based on opinion, so they went astray and led others astray."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، هِشَامٍ، أَبِيهِ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو
narrators_en: Waki, Hisham, His Father, Abdullah bin Amr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ يَزِيدَ، عَنِ ابْنِ سِيرِينَ، عَنِ ابْنِ مَسْعُودٍ، قَالَ: "يُقْطَعُ يَدُ رَجُلٍ أَوَّلَ النَّهَارِ وَيَفِيضُ الْمَالُ مِنْ آخِرِهِ فَلَا يَجِدُ أَحَدًا يَقْبَلُهُ فَيَرَاهُ فَيَقُولُ: يَا حَسْرَتِي , فِي هَذَا قُطِعَتْ يَدِي بِالْأَمْسِ
english_text: Waki narrated from Yazid, from Ibn Sirin, from Ibn Mas'ud, who said: "A man's hand will be cut off at the beginning of the day [for theft], and wealth will overflow at the end of it such that he finds no one to accept it. He will see it and say: 'Oh my sorrow! For this my hand was cut off yesterday.'"
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، يَزِيدَ، ابْنِ سِيرِينَ، ابْنِ مَسْعُودٍ
narrators_en: Waki, Yazid, Ibn Sirin, Ibn Mas'ud

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنِ الْأَعْمَشِ، عَنْ شَقِيقٍ، عَنْ أَبِي مُوسَى، قَالَ: إِنَّ الدِّينَارَ وَالدِّرْهَمَ أَهْلَكَا مَنْ كَانَ قَبْلَكُمْ , وَهُمَا مُهْلِكَاكُمْ
english_text: Waki narrated from Al-A'mash, from Shaqiq, from Abu Musa, who said: "Indeed, the Dinar and the Dirham destroyed those before you, and they are your destroyers."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، الْأَعْمَشِ، شَقِيقٍ، أَبِي مُوسَى
narrators_en: Waki, Al-A'mash, Shaqiq, Abu Musa

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ إِسْرَائِيلَ، عَنْ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، عَنْ وَهْبِ بْنِ جَابِرٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، قَالَ: "إِذَا طَلَعَتِ الشَّمْسُ مِنْ مَغْرِبِهَا ذَهَبَ الرَّجُلُ إِلَى مَالِهِ وَكَنْزِهِ فَيَسْتَخْرِجُهُ فَيَحْمِلُهُ عَلَى ظَهْرِهِ فَيَقُولُ: مَنْ صل لَهُ فِي هَذِهِ، فَيُقَالُ لَهُ: أَفَلَا جِئْتَ بِهِ بِالْأَمْسِ , فَلَا يُقْبَلُ فَيَجِيءُ إِلَى الْمَكَانِ الَّذِي احْتَفَرَهُ فَيَضْرِبُ بِهِ الْأَرْضَ وَيَقُولُ: لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أَرَكَ
english_text: Waki narrated from Isra'il, from Abu Ishaq, from Wahb bin Jabir, from Abdullah bin Amr, who said: "When the sun rises from its west, a man will go to his wealth and treasure, extract it, and carry it on his back saying: 'Who will take this for me?' It will be said to him: 'Why did you not bring it yesterday?' It will not be accepted. So he will go to the place where he dug it up and strike the earth with it, saying: 'I wish I had not seen you.'"
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، إِسْرَائِيلَ، أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، وَهْبِ بْنِ جَابِرٍ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو
narrators_en: Waki, Isra'il, Abu Ishaq, Wahb bin Jabir, Abdullah bin Amr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ فُضَيْلِ بْنِ غَزْوَانَ، عَنْ أَبِي حَازِمٍ، عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: ثَلَاثٌ إِذَا خَرَجْنَ لَا يَنْفَعُ نَفْسًا إِيمَانُهَا لَمْ تَكُنْ آمَنَتْ مِنْ قَبْلُ: طُلُوعُ الشَّمْسِ مِنْ مَغْرِبِهَا، وَالدَّجَّالُ، وَالدَّابَّةُ
english_text: Waki narrated from Fudail bin Ghazwan, from Abu Hazim, from Abu Hurairah, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Three things, if they appear, no soul will benefit from its faith if it had not believed before: The rising of the sun from its west, the Dajjal, and the Beast."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، فُضَيْلِ بْنِ غَزْوَانَ، أَبِي حَازِمٍ، أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ
narrators_en: Waki, Fudail bin Ghazwan, Abu Hazim, Abu Hurairah

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَنْ عَطِيَّةَ، عَنْ أَبِي سَعِيدٍ، {يَوْمَ يَأْتِي بَعْضُ آيَاتِ رَبِّكَ لَا يَنْفَعُ نَفْسًا إِيمَانُهَا} [الأنعام: 158] قَالَ: طُلُوعُ الشَّمْسِ مِنْ مَغْرِبِهَا
english_text: Waki narrated from Ibn Abi Laila, from Atiyyah, from Abu Sa'id, regarding {The Day some of the signs of your Lord will come no soul will benefit from its faith} [Al-An'am: 158], he said: "The rising of the sun from its west."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، ابْنِ أَبِي لَيْلَى، عَطِيَّةَ، أَبِي سَعِيدٍ
narrators_en: Waki, Ibn Abi Laila, Atiyyah, Abu Sa'id

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنْ قَتَادَةَ، عَنْ زُرَارَةَ بْنِ أَبِي أَوْفَى، عَنِ ابْنِ مَسْعُودٍ، قَالَ: طُلُوعُ الشَّمْسِ مِنْ مَغْرِبِهَا
english_text: Waki narrated from Shu'bah, from Qatadah, from Zurarah bin Abi Awfa, from Ibn Mas'ud, who said: "The rising of the sun from its west."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، شُعْبَةَ، قَتَادَةَ، زُرَارَةَ بْنِ أَبِي أَوْفَى، ابْنِ مَسْعُودٍ
narrators_en: Waki, Shu'bah, Qatadah, Zurarah bin Abi Awfa, Ibn Mas'ud

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ مَنْصُورٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، عَنْ عَائِشَةَ، قَالَتْ: إِذَا خَرَجَتْ أَوَّلُ الْآيَاتِ حُبِسَتِ الْحَفَظَةُ، وَطُرِحَتِ الْأَقْلَامُ، وَشَهِدَتِ الْأَجْسَادُ عَلَى الْأَعْمَالِ
english_text: Waki narrated from Sufyan, from Mansur, from Ash-Sha'bi, from Aisha, who said: "When the first of the signs appear, the guarding angels will be held back, the pens will be cast down, and the bodies will bear witness to the deeds."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، مَنْصُورٍ، الشَّعْبِيِّ، عَائِشَةَ
narrators_en: Waki, Sufyan, Mansur, Ash-Sha'bi, Aisha

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ، عَنْ أَبِي خَيْثَمَةَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، قَالَ: يَمْكُثُ النَّاسُ بَعْدَ طُلُوعِ الشَّمْسِ مِنْ مَغْرِبِهَا عِشْرِينَ وَمِائَةً
english_text: Waki narrated from Isma'il, from Abu Khaithamah, from Abdullah bin Amr, who said: "People will remain for one hundred and twenty [years] after the rising of the sun from its west."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، إِسْمَاعِيلَ، أَبِي خَيْثَمَةَ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو
narrators_en: Waki, Isma'il, Abu Khaithamah, Abdullah bin Amr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنِ ابْنِ عَوْنٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ سِيرِينَ، قَالَ: قَالَ ابْنُ مَسْعُودٍ كُلُّ مَا وَعَدَ اللَّهُ وَرَسُولُهُ قَدْ رَأَيْنَا غَيْرَ أَرْبَعٍ طُلُوعُ الشَّمْسِ مِنْ مَغْرِبِهَا، وَالدَّجَّالُ، وَالدَّابَّةُ، وَيَأْجُوجُ وَمَأْجُوجُ
english_text: Waki' told us, from Ibn 'Awn, from Ibn Sirin, who said: Ibn Mas'ud said: "Everything that Allah and His Messenger promised, we have seen, except for four: the rising of the sun from its west, the Dajjal, the Beast, and Gog and Magog."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، ابْنِ عَوْنٍ، ابْنِ سِيرِينَ، ابْنُ مَسْعُودٍ
narrators_en: Waki', Ibn 'Awn, Ibn Sirin, Ibn Mas'ud

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، قَالَ يَأْتِي عَلَى النَّاسِ زَمَانٌ يَكُونُ الْجَمَلُ الضَّابِطُ أَحَبَّ إِلَى أَحَدِكُمْ مِنْ أَهْلِهِ وَمَالِهِ
english_text: Waki' told us, from Isma'il, from his father, from Abu Huraira, who said: "A time will come upon the people when a strong camel will be more beloved to one of you than his family and his wealth."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، إِسْمَاعِيلَ، أَبِيهِ، أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ
narrators_en: Waki', Isma'il, his father, Abu Huraira

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ، عَنِ الرَّبِيعِ، عَنْ أَبِي الْعَالِيَةِ، عَنْ أُبَيٍّ {قُلْ هُوَ الْقَادِرُ عَلَى أَنْ يَبْعَثَ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابًا مِنْ فَوْقِكُمْ أَوْ مِنْ تَحْتِ أَرْجُلِكُمْ أَوْ يَلْبِسَكُمْ شِيَعًا وَيُذِيقَ بَعْضَكُمْ بَأْسَ بَعْضٍ} قَالَ "هِيَ أَرْبَعُ خِلَالٍ , وَكُلُّهُنَّ وَاقِعٌ لَا مَحَالَةَ , فَمَضَتِ اثْنَتَانِ بَعْدَ وَفَاةِ النَّبِيِّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ بِخَمْسَةٍ وَعِشْرِينَ عَامًا , وَأُلْبِسُوا شِيَعًا وَذَاقَ بَعْضُهُمْ بَأْسَ بَعْضٍ , وَاثْنَتَانِ وَاقِعَتَانِ لَا مَحَالَةَ: الْخَسْفُ وَالرَّجْمُ
english_text: Waki' told us, from Abu Ja'far, from Al-Rabi', from Abu al-'Aliya, from Ubayy regarding {Say, "He is the [one] Able to send upon you affliction from above you or from beneath your feet or to confuse you [so you become] sects and make you taste the violence of one another."}, he said: "They are four characteristics, and all of them will inevitably occur. Two passed twenty-five years after the death of the Prophet (peace be upon him): they became divided into sects and tasted the violence of one another. And two will inevitably occur: swallowing by the earth (Khasf) and stoning (Rajm)."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ، الرَّبِيعِ، أَبِي الْعَالِيَةِ، أُبَيٍّ
narrators_en: Waki', Abu Ja'far, Al-Rabi', Abu al-'Aliya, Ubayy

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ عُبَادَةَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ الْفَزَارِيِّ، عَنْ جُبَيْرِ بْنِ أَبِي سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ جُبَيْرِ بْنِ مُطْعِمٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ كَانَ يَقُولُ فِي دُعَائِهِ: اللَّهُمَّ إِنِّي أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ أَنْ أُغْتَالَ مِنْ تَحْتِي يَعْنِي الْخَسْفَ
english_text: Waki' told us, from 'Ubada bin Muslim al-Fazari, from Jubayr bin Abi Sulayman bin Jubayr bin Mut'im, from Ibn Umar, that the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to say in his supplication: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from being taken unawares from beneath me," meaning swallowing by the earth (Khasf).
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، عُبَادَةَ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ الْفَزَارِيِّ، جُبَيْرِ بْنِ أَبِي سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ جُبَيْرِ بْنِ مُطْعِمٍ، ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Waki', 'Ubada b. Muslim al-Fazari, Jubayr b. Abi Sulayman b. Jubayr b. Mut'im, Ibn Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنِ الْوَلِيدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جُمَيْعٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ، عَنِ ابْنِ الْبَيْلَمَانِيِّ، عَنِ ابْنِ عُمَرَ، قَالَ: "تَخْرُجُ الدَّابَّةُ لَيْلَةَ جَمْعٍ وَالنَّاسُ يَسِيرُونَ إِلَى مِنًى فَتَحْمِلُهُمْ بَيْنَ عَجُزِهَا وَذَنَبِهَا فَلَا يَبْقَى مُنَافِقٌ إِلَّا خَطَمَتْهُ , قَالَ: وَتَمْسَحُ الْمُؤْمِنَ قَالَ: فَيُصْبِحُونَ وَهُمْ أَشَرُّ مِنَ الدَّجَّالِ
english_text: Waki' told us, from Al-Walid bin 'Abd Allah bin Jumay', from 'Abd al-Malik bin al-Mughira, from Ibn al-Baylamani, from Ibn Umar, who said: "The Beast will emerge on the night of Muzdalifah (Jam') while the people are proceeding to Mina. It will carry them between its hindquarters and its tail. No hypocrite will remain except that it marks his nose." He said: "And it will wipe [the face of] the believer." He said: "So they will wake up being worse than the Dajjal."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، الْوَلِيدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ جُمَيْعٍ، عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ، ابْنِ الْبَيْلَمَانِيِّ، ابْنِ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Waki', Al-Walid b. 'Abd Allah b. Jumay', 'Abd al-Malik b. al-Mughira, Ibn al-Baylamani, Ibn Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ، عَنْ إِسْرَائِيلَ، عَنْ سِمَاكٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، قَالَ: دَابَّةُ الْأَرْضِ تَخْرُجُ مِنْ مَكَّةَ
english_text: Waki' told us, from Isra'il, from Simak, from Ibrahim, who said: "The Beast of the Earth will emerge from Mecca."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، إِسْرَائِيلَ، سِمَاكٍ، إِبْرَاهِيمَ
narrators_en: Waki', Isra'il, Simak, Ibrahim

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا الْفَضْلُ بْنُ دُكَيْنٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا زُهَيْرٌ، عَنْ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، قَالَ: قَالَتْ عَائِشَةُ: الدَّابَّةُ تَخْرُجُ مِنْ أَجْيَادَ
english_text: Al-Fadl bin Dukayn told us, he said Zuhayr told us, from Abu Ishaq, who said: Aisha said: "The Beast will emerge from Ajyad."
narrators_ar: الْفَضْلُ بْنُ دُكَيْنٍ، زُهَيْرٌ، أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، عَائِشَةُ
narrators_en: Al-Fadl b. Dukayn, Zuhayr, Abu Ishaq, Aisha

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حُسَيْنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ جُدْعَانَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، قَالَ: تَخْرُجُ الدَّابَّةُ مِنْ جَبَلِ أَجْيَادَ أَيَّامَ التَّشْرِيقِ وَالنَّاسُ بِمِنًى قَالَ فَلِذَلِكَ حُيِّيَ سَائِقُ الْحَاجِّ إِذَا جَاءَ بِسَلَامَةِ النَّاسِ
english_text: Husayn bin Ali told us, from Ali bin Jud'an, from 'Abd al-Malik bin 'Umayr, from 'Abd Allah bin 'Amr, who said: "The Beast will emerge from the mountain of Ajyad during the Days of Tashriq while the people are at Mina." He said: "Therefore, the leader of the pilgrims is greeted if he arrives with the safety of the people."
narrators_ar: حُسَيْنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ، عَلِيِّ بْنِ جُدْعَانَ، عَبْدِ الْمَلِكِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو
narrators_en: Husayn b. Ali, Ali b. Jud'an, 'Abd al-Malik b. 'Umayr, 'Abd Allah b. 'Amr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا جَرِيرٌ عَنْ مَنْصُورٍ، عَنِ الشَّعْبِيِّ، قَالَ: قَالَتْ عَائِشَةُ: إِذَا ظَهَرَ أَوَّلُ الْآيَاتِ رُفِعَتِ الْأَقْلَامُ، وَشَهِدَتِ الْأَجْسَادُ عَلَى الْأَعْمَالِ، وَحُبِسَتِ الْحَفَظَةُ
english_text: Jarir told us, from Mansur, from Al-Sha'bi, who said: Aisha said: "When the first of the signs appears, the pens will be lifted, the bodies will testify to the deeds, and the recording angels will be held back."
narrators_ar: جَرِيرٌ، مَنْصُورٍ، الشَّعْبِيِّ، عَائِشَةُ
narrators_en: Jarir, Mansur, Al-Sha'bi, Aisha

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا هِشَامُ، عَنْ حَفْصَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي الْعَالِيَةِ، قَالَ: مَا بَيْنَ أَوَّلِ الْآيَاتِ وَآخِرِهَا سِتَّةُ أَشْهُرٍ تَتَابَعُ كَمَا تَتَابَعُ الْخَرَزُ فِي النِّظَامِ
english_text: Yazid bin Harun told us, he said Hisham informed us, from Hafsa, from Abu al-'Aliya, who said: "Between the first of the signs and the last of them is six months; they follow one another like beads follow one another on a string."
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، هِشَامُ، حَفْصَةَ، أَبِي الْعَالِيَةِ
narrators_en: Yazid b. Harun, Hisham, Hafsa, Abu al-'Aliya

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ قَالَ أَخْبَرَنَا حَمَّادُ بْنُ سَلَمَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي الْمِهْزَمِ، عَنْ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، قَالَ: مَا بَيْنَ أَوَّلِ الْآيَاتِ وَآخِرِهَا ثَمَانِيَةُ أَشْهُرٍ
english_text: Yazid bin Harun told us, he said Hammad bin Salama informed us, from Abu al-Mihzam, from Abu Huraira, who said: "Between the first of the signs and the last of them is eight months."
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، حَمَّادُ بْنُ سَلَمَةَ، أَبِي الْمِهْزَمِ، أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ
narrators_en: Yazid b. Harun, Hammad b. Salama, Abu al-Mihzam, Abu Huraira

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا عِمْرَانُ بْنُ حُدَيْرٍ، عَنِ السُّمَيْطِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ، عَنْ كَعْبٍ، قَالَ: كَأَنِّي بِمُقَدِّمَةِ الْأَعْوَرِ الدَّجَّالِ سِتُّمِائَةِ أَلْفٍ مِنَ الْعَرَبِ يَلْبَسُونَ السِّيجَانَ ; وَيَزِيدُ لِي تَصْدِيقًا مَا أَرَى نَعْشُو مِنْهَا
english_text: Yazid bin Harun told us, he said 'Imran bin Hudayr informed us, from Al-Sumayt bin 'Umayr, from Ka'b, who said: "It is as if I see the vanguard of the one-eyed Dajjal, six hundred thousand of the Arabs, wearing Persian cloaks (Taylasan/Sijan). And what I see us suffering from increases my belief [in this]."
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، عِمْرَانُ بْنُ حُدَيْرٍ، السُّمَيْطِ بْنِ عُمَيْرٍ، كَعْبٍ
narrators_en: Yazid b. Harun, 'Imran b. Hudayr, Al-Sumayt b. 'Umayr, Ka'b

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ حَبِيبٍ، عَنْ أَبِي الْبَخْتَرِيِّ، قَالَ: قِيلَ لِحُذَيْفَةَ: أَلَا نَأْمُرُ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَنَنْهَى عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ؟ قَالَ: إِنَّهُ لَحَسَنٌ , وَلَكِنْ لَيْسَ مِنَ السُّنَّةِ أَنْ تَرْفَعَ السِّلَاحَ عَلَى إِمَامِكَ
english_text: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Habib, from Abu al-Bakhtari, who said: It was said to Hudhayfa: "Should we not enjoin good and forbid evil?" He said: "Indeed, it is good, but it is not from the Sunnah to raise weapons against your Imam."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، حَبِيبٍ، أَبِي الْبَخْتَرِيِّ، حُذَيْفَةَ
narrators_en: Waki', Sufyan, Habib, Abu al-Bakhtari, Hudhayfa

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا حُسَيْنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ زَائِدَةَ، عَنْ هِشَامٍ، عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِيرِينَ، عَنْ عُقْبَةَ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، قَالَ: "كُنْتُ رَجُلًا عَزِيزَ النَّفْسِ، حَمِيَّ الْأَنْفِ، لَا يَسْتَقِلُّ أَحَدٌ مِنِّي شَيْئًا , سُلْطَانٌ وَلَا غَيْرُهُ , قَالَ: فَأَصْبَحْتُ أُمَرَائِي يُخَيِّرُونَنِي بَيْنَ أَنْ أَصْبِرَ لَهُمْ عَلَى قُبْحِ وَجْهِي وَرَغْمِ أَنْفِي وَبَيْنَ أَنْ آخُذَ سَيْفِي فَأَضْرِبَ بِهِ فَأَدْخُلَ النَّارَ , فَاخْتَرْتُ أَنْ أَصْبِرَ عَلَى قُبْحِ وَجْهِي وَرَغْمِ أَنْفِي , وَلَا آخُذُ سَيْفِي فَأَضْرِبَ فَأَدْخُلَ النَّارَ
english_text: Husayn bin Ali told us, from Za'ida, from Hisham, from Muhammad bin Sirin, from 'Uqba bin 'Amr, who said: "I was a man of high esteem, proud, no one could belittle me in anything, neither a ruler nor anyone else. He said: But now my leaders give me a choice between being patient with them despite my humiliation and unwillingness, or taking my sword and striking with it and thus entering the Fire. So I chose to be patient despite my humiliation and unwillingness, rather than taking my sword and striking and entering the Fire."
narrators_ar: حُسَيْنُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ، زَائِدَةَ، هِشَامٍ، مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِيرِينَ، عُقْبَةَ بْنِ عَمْرٍو
narrators_en: Husayn b. Ali, Za'ida, Hisham, Muhammad b. Sirin, 'Uqba b. 'Amr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ عَنِ التَّيْمِيِّ، عَنْ نُعَيْمِ بْنِ أَبِي هِنْدٍ، أَنَّ أَبَا مَسْعُودٍ خَرَجَ مِنَ الْكُوفَةِ وَرَأْسُهُ يَقْطُرُ، وَهُوَ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يُحْرِمَ، فَقَالُوا لَهُ: أَوْصِنَا , فَقَالَ: أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ , اتَّهِمُوا الرَّأْيَ، فَقَدْ رَأَيْتُنِي أَهِمُّ أَنْ أَضْرِبَ بِسَيْفِي فِي مَعْصِيَةِ اللَّهِ وَمَعْصِيَةِ رَسُولِهِ , قَالُوا: أَوْصِنَا , قَالَ: عَلَيْكُمْ بِالْجَمَاعَةِ؛ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَمْ يَكُنْ لِيَجْمَعَ أُمَّةَ مُحَمَّدٍ عَلَى ضَلَالَةٍ , قَالَ: قَالُوا: أَوْصِنَا , فَقَالَ: بِتَقْوَى اللَّهِ، وَالصَّبْرِ حَتَّى يَسْتَرِيحَ بَرٌّ، أَوْ يُسْتَرَاحُ مِنْ فَاجِرٍ
english_text: Yazid bin Harun told us, from Al-Taymi, from Nu'aym bin Abi Hind, that Abu Mas'ud left Kufa while his head was dripping, intending to enter Ihram. They said to him: "Advise us." He said: "O people, suspect your opinion, for I saw myself intending to strike with my sword in disobedience to Allah and disobedience to His Messenger." They said: "Advise us." He said: "Stick to the Jama'ah (community), for Allah would not unite the Ummah of Muhammad on error." They said: "Advise us." He said: "Fear Allah, and have patience until a righteous person finds rest, or [people] find rest from a wicked person."
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، التَّيْمِيِّ، نُعَيْمِ بْنِ أَبِي هِنْدٍ، أَبَا مَسْعُودٍ
narrators_en: Yazid b. Harun, Al-Taymi, Nu'aym b. Abi Hind, Abu Mas'ud

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا زَيْدُ بْنُ الْحُبَابِ قَالَ أَخْبَرَنَا مُوسَى بْنُ عُبَيْدَةَ، قَالَ أَخْبَرَنِي زَيْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي سَلَامَةَ أَبُو سَلَمَةَ، عَنْ أَبِي الرَّبَابِ، وَصَاحِبٍ، لَهُ أَنَّهُمَا سَمِعَا أَبَا ذَرٍّ، يَدْعُو , قَالَ: فَقُلْنَا لَهُ: رَأَيْنَاكَ صَلَّيْتَ فِي هَذَا الْبَلَدِ صَلَاةً لَمْ نَرَ أَطْوَلَ مَقَامًا وَرُكُوعًا وَسُجُودًا , فَلَمَّا أَنْ فَرَغْتَ رَفَعْتَ يَدَيْكَ فَدَعَوْتَ فَتَعَوَّذْتَ مِنْ يَوْمِ الثُّلَاثَاءِ وَيَوْمِ الْعَوْرَةِ , قَالَ: فَمَا أَنْكَرْتُمْ؟ فَأَخْبَرْنَاهُ , قَالَ: أَمَّا يَوْمُ الثُّلَاثَاءِ فَتَلْتَقِي فِئَتَانِ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ فَيَقْتُلُ بَعْضُهُمْ بَعْضًا وَيَوْمُ الْعَوْرَةِ إِنَّ النِّسَاءَ مِنَ الْمُسْلِمَاتِ يُسْبَيْنَ فَيُكْشَفُ عَنْ سُوقِهِنَّ , فَأَيَّتُهُنَّ أَعْظَمُ سَاقًا اشْتُرِيَتْ عَلَى عِظَمِ سَاقِهَا , فَدَعَوْتُ أَنْ لَا يُدْرِكَنِي هَذَا الزَّمَانُ , وَلَعَلَّكُمَا تُدْرِكَانِهِ , قَالَ: فَقُتِلَ عُثْمَانُ وَأَرْسَلَ مُعَاوِيَةُ ابْنَ أَبِي أَرْطَاةَ إِلَى الْيَمَنِ فَسَبَى نِسَاءً مِنَ الْمُسْلِمَاتِ فَأَقِمْنَ فِي السُّوقِ
english_text: Zayd bin al-Hubab told us, he said Musa bin 'Ubayda informed us, he said Zayd bin 'Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Salama Abu Salama informed me, from Abu al-Rabab and a companion of his, that they heard Abu Dharr supplicating. He said: We said to him: "We saw you praying a prayer in this land whose standing, bowing, and prostration we have never seen longer. When you finished, you raised your hands and supplicated, seeking refuge from the Day of Tuesday and the Day of 'Awrah." He said: "What did you find strange?" So we told him. He said: "As for the Day of Tuesday, two factions of Muslims will meet and kill one another. And the Day of 'Awrah: indeed, Muslim women will be taken captive and their calves will be uncovered; whichever of them has the largest calves will be bought based on the size of her calves. So I prayed that this time does not overtake me, but perhaps you two will reach it." He said: Then Uthman was killed, and Mu'awiya sent Ibn Abi Artah to Yemen, and he took Muslim women captive, and they were put up in the market.
narrators_ar: زَيْدُ بْنُ الْحُبَابِ، مُوسَى بْنُ عُبَيْدَةَ، زَيْدُ بْنُ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ أَبِي سَلَامَةَ أَبُو سَلَمَةَ، أَبِي الرَّبَابِ، أَبَا ذَرٍّ
narrators_en: Zayd b. al-Hubab, Musa b. 'Ubayda, Zayd b. 'Abd al-Rahman b. Abi Salama Abu Salama, Abu al-Rabab, Abu Dharr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ حَبِيبٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، عَنْ عَلْقَمَةَ، قَالَ: إِذَا ظَهَرَ أَهْلُ الْحَقِّ عَلَى أَهْلِ الْبَاطِلِ فَلَيْسَ هِيَ بِفِتْنَةٍ
english_text: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Habib, from Ibrahim, from 'Alqama, who said: "If the people of truth prevail over the people of falsehood, then it is not a fitnah."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، حَبِيبٍ، إِبْرَاهِيمَ، عَلْقَمَةَ
narrators_en: Waki', Sufyan, Habib, Ibrahim, 'Alqama

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنِ الْحَارِثِ بْنِ حَصِيرَةَ، عَنْ زَيْدِ بْنِ وَهْبٍ، قَالَ: قِيلَ لِحُذَيْفَةَ: مَا وَقَفَاتُ الْفِتْنَةِ وَمَا بَعَثَاتُهَا؟ قَالَ: بَعَثَاتُهَا سَلُّ السَّيْفِ، وَوَقَفَاتُهَا غَمْدُهُ
english_text: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Al-Harith bin Hasira, from Zayd bin Wahb, who said: It was said to Hudhayfa: "What are the pauses of the fitnah and what are its uprisings?" He said: "Its uprisings are the drawing of the sword, and its pauses are sheathing it."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، الْحَارِثِ بْنِ حَصِيرَةَ، زَيْدِ بْنِ وَهْبٍ، حُذَيْفَةَ
narrators_en: Waki', Sufyan, Al-Harith b. Hasira, Zayd b. Wahb, Hudhayfa

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وُهَيْبٌ، قَالَ أَخْبَرَنَا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ طَاوُسٍ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، عَنْ أَبِي مُوسَى، أَنَّهُ لَقِيَهُ فَذَكَرَ الْفِتْنَةَ فَقَالَ: إِنَّ هَذِهِ الْفِتْنَةَ حَيْصَةٌ مِنْ حَيْصَاتِ الْفِتَنِ , وَإِنَّهَا لَقِيَتِ الرِّدَاحَ الْمُطْبِقَةَ , مَنْ أَشْرَفَ لَهَا أَشْرَفَتْ لَهُ , وَمَنْ مَاجَ لَهَا مَاجَتْ لَهُ
english_text: Wuheib told us, he said 'Abd Allah bin Tawus informed us, from his father, from Abu Musa, that he met him and mentioned the fitnah, so he said: "Indeed, this fitnah is a surge from the surges of fitan, and it has encountered a heavy, enveloping one. Whoever looks out for it, it looks out for him; and whoever agitates it, it agitates him."
narrators_ar: وُهَيْبٌ، عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ طَاوُسٍ، أَبِيهِ، أَبِي مُوسَى
narrators_en: Wuheib, 'Abd Allah b. Tawus, his father, Abu Musa

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَفَّانَ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا حَمَّادُ بْنُ سَلَمَةَ، عَنْ عَطَاءِ بْنِ السَّائِبِ، عَنْ أَبِيهِ، قَالَ: قَالَ لِي عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ عَمْرٍو: مِمَّنْ أَنْتَ؟ قُلْتُ: مِنْ أَهْلِ الْكُوفَةِ , قَالَ: وَالَّذِي نَفْسِي فِي يَدِهِ , لَتُسَاقُنَّ مِنْهَا إِلَى أَرْضِ الْعَرَبِ لَا تَمْلِكُونَ قَفِيزًا وَلَا دِرْهَمًا، ثُمَّ لَا يُنْجِيكُمْ
english_text: 'Affan told us, he said Hammad bin Salama told us, from 'Ata' bin al-Sa'ib, from his father, who said: 'Abd Allah bin 'Amr said to me: "Where are you from?" I said: "From the people of Kufa." He said: "By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, you will surely be driven from it to the land of the Arabs, owning neither a Qafiz nor a Dirham, then it will not save you."
narrators_ar: عَفَّانَ، حَمَّادُ بْنُ سَلَمَةَ، عَطَاءِ بْنِ السَّائِبِ، أَبِيهِ، عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ عَمْرٍو
narrators_en: 'Affan, Hammad b. Salama, 'Ata' b. al-Sa'ib, his father, 'Abd Allah b. 'Amr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُحَاضِرٌ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا الْأَجْلَحُ، عَنْ قَيْسِ بْنِ أَبِي مُسْلِمٍ، عَنْ رِبْعِيِّ بْنِ حِرَاشٍ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ حُذَيْفَةَ، يَقُولُ: لَوْ خَرَجَ الدَّجَّالُ لَآمَنَ بِهِ قَوْمٌ فِي قُبُورِهِمْ
english_text: Muhadir told us, he said Al-Ajlah told us, from Qays bin Abi Muslim, from Rib'i bin Hirash, who said: I heard Hudhayfa saying: "If the Dajjal were to come out, people in their graves would believe in him."
narrators_ar: مُحَاضِرٌ، الْأَجْلَحُ، قَيْسِ بْنِ أَبِي مُسْلِمٍ، رِبْعِيِّ بْنِ حِرَاشٍ، حُذَيْفَةَ
narrators_en: Muhadir, Al-Ajlah, Qays b. Abi Muslim, Rib'i b. Hirash, Hudhayfa

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو بَكْرٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا الْفَضْلُ بْنُ دُكَيْنٍ، قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا يُونُسُ بْنُ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، عَنْ عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ بَشِيرِ بْنِ جَرِيرٍ الْبَجَلِيِّ، قَالَ: قَالَ عَلِيٌّ: إِنَّ آخِرَ خَارِجَةٍ تَخْرُجُ فِي الْإِسْلَامِ بِالرُّمَيْلَةِ رُمَيْلَةُ الدَّسْكَرَةِ , فَيَخْرُجُ إِلَيْهِمُ النَّاسُ فَيَقْتُلُونَ مِنْهُمْ ثُلُثًا , وَيَدْخُلُ ثُلُثٌ وَيَتَحَصَّنُ ثُلُثٌ فِي الدَّيْرِ دَيْرُ مِرْمَارَ، فَمِنْهُمُ الْأَشْمَطُ، فَيَحْضُرُهُمُ النَّاسُ فَيُنْزِلُونَهُمْ فَيَقْتُلُونَهُمْ , فَهِيَ آخِرُ خَارِجَةٍ تَخْرُجُ فِي الْإِسْلَامِ
english_text: Abu Bakr told us, he said Al-Fadl bin Dukayn told us, he said Yunus bin Abi Ishaq told us, from 'Ubayd Allah bin Bashir bin Jarir al-Bajali, who said: Ali said: "The last rebellion to emerge in Islam will be at Al-Rumayla, Rumaylat al-Daskara. The people will go out to them and kill a third of them, a third will enter, and a third will fortify themselves in the monastery, Dayr Mirmar. Among them will be the gray-haired one. The people will besiege them, bring them down, and kill them. That is the last rebellion to emerge in Islam."
narrators_ar: أَبُو بَكْرٍ، الْفَضْلُ بْنُ دُكَيْنٍ، يُونُسُ بْنُ أَبِي إِسْحَاقَ، عُبَيْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ بَشِيرِ بْنِ جَرِيرٍ الْبَجَلِيِّ، عَلِيٌّ
narrators_en: Abu Bakr, Al-Fadl b. Dukayn, Yunus b. Abi Ishaq, 'Ubayd Allah b. Bashir b. Jarir al-Bajali, Ali

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا الْفَضْلُ بْنُ دُكَيْنٍ قَالَ أَخْبَرَنَا جَعْفَرُ بْنُ بُرْقَانَ، عَنْ رَاشِدٍ الْأَزْرَقِ، عَنْ عُقْبَةَ بْنِ نَافِعٍ، قَالَ: سَأَلْتُ ابْنَ عُمَرَ: مَعَ مَنْ أُقَاتِلُ , قَالَ: مَعَ الَّذِينَ يُقَاتِلُونَ لِلَّهِ , وَلَا تُقَاتِلُ مَعَ الَّذِينَ يُقَاتِلُونَ لِهَذَا الدِّينَارِ وَالدِّرْهَمِ
english_text: Al-Fadl bin Dukayn told us, he said Ja'far bin Burqan informed us, from Rashid al-Azraq, from 'Uqba bin Nafi', who said: I asked Ibn Umar: "With whom should I fight?" He said: "With those who fight for Allah, and do not fight with those who fight for this Dinar and Dirham."
narrators_ar: الْفَضْلُ بْنُ دُكَيْنٍ، جَعْفَرُ بْنُ بُرْقَانَ، رَاشِدٍ الْأَزْرَقِ، عُقْبَةَ بْنِ نَافِعٍ، ابْنَ عُمَرَ
narrators_en: Al-Fadl b. Dukayn, Ja'far b. Burqan, Rashid al-Azraq, 'Uqba b. Nafi', Ibn Umar

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا الْفَضْلُ بْنُ دُكَيْنٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ السَّلَامِ السُّلَمِيُّ، قَالَ: حَدَّثَنِي وَبَرَةُ، عَنْ مُجَاهِدٍ، قَالَ: لَا تَرَوْنَ الْفَرَجَ حَتَّى يَمْلِكَ أَرْبَعَةٌ كُلُّهُمْ مِنْ صُلْبِ رَجُلٍ وَاحِدٍ , فَإِذَا كَانَ ذَلِكَ فَعَسَى
english_text: Al-Fadl bin Dukayn told us, he said 'Abd al-Salam al-Sulami told us, he said Wabara told me, from Mujahid, who said: "You will not see relief until four rule, all of them from the loins of one man. When that happens, then perhaps [relief will come]."
narrators_ar: الْفَضْلُ بْنُ دُكَيْنٍ، عَبْدُ السَّلَامِ السُّلَمِيُّ، وَبَرَةُ، مُجَاهِدٍ
narrators_en: Al-Fadl b. Dukayn, 'Abd al-Salam al-Sulami, Wabara, Mujahid

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ هِشَامٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ حُصَيْنٍ، عَنْ أَبِي ظَبْيَانَ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو، قَالَ: أَوَّلُ الْأَرْضِ خَرَابًا الشَّامُ
english_text: Mu'awiya bin Hisham told us, he said Sufyan told us, from Husayn, from Abu Dhabyan, from 'Abd Allah bin 'Amr, who said: "The first of the lands to be ruined is Al-Sham."
narrators_ar: مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ هِشَامٍ، سُفْيَانُ، حُصَيْنٍ، أَبِي ظَبْيَانَ، عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَمْرٍو
narrators_en: Mu'awiya b. Hisham, Sufyan, Husayn, Abu Dhabyan, 'Abd Allah b. 'Amr

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا غُنْدَرٌ، عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنِ الْحَكَمِ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا صَادِقٍ، يُحَدِّثُ عَنِ الرَّبِيعِ بْنِ نَاجِذٍ، عَنِ ابْنِ مَسْعُودٍ، قَالَ: يَأْتِيكُمْ قَوْمٌ مِنْ قِبَلِ الْمَشْرِقِ، عِرَاضُ الْوُجُوهِ، صِغَارُ الْعُيُونِ، كَأَنَّمَا ثُقِبَتْ أَعْيُنُهُمْ فِي الصَّخْرِ كَأَنَّ وُجُوهَهُمُ الْمَجَانُّ الْمُطْرَقَةُ , حَتَّى يُوَثِّقُوا خُيُولَهُمْ بِشَطِّ الْفُرَاتِ
english_text: Ghundar told us, from Shu'ba, from Al-Hakam, who said: I heard Abu Sadiq narrating from Al-Rabi' bin Najidh, from Ibn Mas'ud, who said: "A people will come to you from the direction of the East, with broad faces and small eyes, as if their eyes were pierced in rock, as if their faces are hammered shields, until they tether their horses at the bank of the Euphrates."
narrators_ar: غُنْدَرٌ، شُعْبَةَ، الْحَكَمِ، أَبَا صَادِقٍ، الرَّبِيعِ بْنِ نَاجِذٍ، ابْنِ مَسْعُودٍ
narrators_en: Ghundar, Shu'ba, Al-Hakam, Abu Sadiq, Al-Rabi' b. Najidh, Ibn Mas'ud

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ قَالَ: أَخْبَرَنَا ابْنُ عَوْنٍ، عَنْ عُمَيْرِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا هُرَيْرَةَ، يَقُولُ: وَيْلٌ لِلْعَرَبِ مِنْ شَرٍّ قَدِ اقْتَرَبَ , أَطَلَّتْ وَاللَّهِ , لَهِيَ أَسْرَعُ إِلَيْهِمْ مِنَ الْفَرَسِ الْمُضْمَرِ السَّرِيعِ الْفِتْنَةُ الصَّمَّاءُ الْمُشْبِهَةُ ; يُصْبِحُ الرَّجُلُ فِيهَا عَلَى أَمْرٍ وَيُمْسِي عَلَى أَمْرٍ , الْقَاعِدُ فِيهَا خَيْرٌ مِنَ الْقَائِمِ , وَالْقَائِمُ فِيهَا خَيْرٌ مِنَ الْمَاشِي , وَالْمَاشِي فِيهَا خَيْرٌ مِنَ السَّاعِي , وَلَوْ أُحَدِّثُكُمْ بِكُلِّ الَّذِي أَعْلَمُ لَقَطَعْتُمْ عُنُقِي مِنْ هَاهُنَا وَأَخَذَ قَفَاهُ بِحَرْفِ كَفِّهِ اللَّهُمَّ لَا تُدْرِكْنَ أَبَا هُرَيْرَةَ إِمْرَةُ الصِّبْيَانِ , وَرَفَعَ يَدَيْهِ حَتَّى جَعَلَ ظُهُورَهُمَا مِمَّا يَلِي بَطْنَ كَفِّهِ
english_text: Yazid bin Harun told us, he said Ibn 'Awn informed us, from 'Umayr bin Ishaq, who said: I heard Abu Huraira saying: "Woe to the Arabs from an evil that has drawn near. It has cast its shadow, by Allah. It is faster to them than a swift, trained horse. The blind, confusing fitnah. A man will wake up in it upon one matter and go to sleep upon another. The one sitting in it is better than the one standing, and the one standing in it is better than the one walking, and the one walking in it is better than the one running. If I were to tell you everything I know, you would cut my neck from here"—and he held his neck with the edge of his hand—"O Allah, let Abu Huraira not reach the rule of boys." And he raised his hands until he made the backs of them facing the palm of his hand.
narrators_ar: يَزِيدُ بْنُ هَارُونَ، ابْنُ عَوْنٍ، عُمَيْرِ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ، أَبَا هُرَيْرَةَ
narrators_en: Yazid b. Harun, Ibn 'Awn, 'Umayr b. Ishaq, Abu Huraira

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا شَبَابَةُ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُلَيْمَانُ، عَنْ ثَابِتٍ، عَنْ أَنَسٍ، قَالَ: "لَيَأْتِيَنَّ عَلَى النَّاسِ زَمَانٌ تَجِدُ النِّسْوَةُ النَّعْلَ مُلْقًى عَلَى الطَّرِيقِ , فَيَقُولُ بَعْضُهُنَّ لِبَعْضٍ: قَدْ كَانَتْ هَذَا النَّعْلُ مَرَّةً لِرِجْلٍ
english_text: Shababa told us, he said Sulayman told us, from Thabit, from Anas, who said: "A time will surely come upon the people when women will find a sandal lying on the road, and some of them will say to others: 'This sandal once belonged to a man.'"
narrators_ar: شَبَابَةُ، سُلَيْمَانُ، ثَابِتٍ، أَنَسٍ
narrators_en: Shababa, Sulayman, Thabit, Anas

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا غُنْدَرٌ عَنْ شُعْبَةَ، عَنْ حُصَيْنٍ، قَالَ: كَانَ عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى يَحْضُضُ النَّاسُ أَيَّامَ الْجَمَاجِمِ
english_text: Ghundar told us, from Shu'ba, from Husayn, who said: 'Abd al-Rahman bin Abi Layla used to incite the people during the Days of al-Jamajim.
narrators_ar: غُنْدَرٌ، شُعْبَةَ، حُصَيْنٍ، عَبْدُ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنُ أَبِي لَيْلَى
narrators_en: Ghundar, Shu'ba, Husayn, 'Abd al-Rahman b. Abi Layla

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ هِشَامٍ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ عِيسَى السَّعْدِيِّ، عَنْ رَجُلٍ، كَتَبَ إِلَى أَبِي الْبَخْتَرِيِّ يَسْأَلُهُ عَنْ مَكَانِهِ الَّذِي، هُمْ فِيهِ أَيَّامَ الْجَمَاجِمِ , قَالَ: فَكَتَبَ إِلَيْهِ أَبُو الْبَخْتَرِيِّ: مَنْ شَاءَ قَالَ فِينَا , وَلَوْ عَلِمْتُ شَيْئًا أَفْضَلَ مِنَ الَّذِي أَنَا فِيهِ لَأَتَيْتُهُ
english_text: Mu'awiya bin Hisham told us, he said Sufyan told us, from 'Isa al-Sa'di, from a man who wrote to Abu al-Bakhtari asking him about his position which they were in during the Days of al-Jamajim. He said: So Abu al-Bakhtari wrote to him: "Whoever wishes may say what they want about us. If I knew anything better than what I am in, I would have gone to it."
narrators_ar: مُعَاوِيَةُ بْنُ هِشَامٍ، سُفْيَانُ، عِيسَى السَّعْدِيِّ، رَجُلٍ، أَبِي الْبَخْتَرِيِّ
narrators_en: Mu'awiya b. Hisham, Sufyan, 'Isa al-Sa'di, a man, Abu al-Bakhtari

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ عَنِ الْعَلَاءِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْكَرِيمِ، قَالَ سَمِعَنِي طَلْحَةُ بْنُ مُصَرِّفٍ، ذَاتَ يَوْمٍ وَأَنَا أَضْحَكُ فَقَالَ: إِنَّكَ تَضْحَكُ ضِحْكَ رَجُلٍ لَمْ يَشْهَدْ الْجَمَاجِمَ
english_text: Abu Usama told us, from Al-'Ala' bin 'Abd al-Karim, who said: Talha bin Musarrif heard me one day while I was laughing, so he said: "You laugh the laughter of a man who did not witness Al-Jamajim."
narrators_ar: أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، الْعَلَاءِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْكَرِيمِ، طَلْحَةُ بْنُ مُصَرِّفٍ
narrators_en: Abu Usama, Al-'Ala' b. 'Abd al-Karim, Talha b. Musarrif

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ حَبِيبٍ التَّمَّارِ، قَالَ: سَمِعْتُ زَاذَانَ، يَقُولُ: "وَدِدْتُ أَنَّ دِمَاءَ أَهْلِ الشَّامِ فِي ثَوْبِي , وَأَشَارَ إِلَى ثَوْبِهِ أَوْ قَالَ: فِي حِجْرِي
english_text: Waki' told us, from Al-Qasim bin Habib al-Tammar, who said: I heard Zadhan saying: "I wish that the blood of the people of Al-Sham were in my garment"—and he pointed to his garment—"or he said: in my lap."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ حَبِيبٍ التَّمَّارِ، زَاذَانَ
narrators_en: Waki', Al-Qasim b. Habib al-Tammar, Zadhan

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا قَبِيصَةُ قَالَ: حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ مَنْصُورٍ، عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ، وَخَيْثَمَةَ، أَنَّهُمَا كَرِهَا الْجَمَاجِمَ
english_text: Qabisa told us, he said Sufyan told us, from Mansur, from Ibrahim and Khaythama, that they both disliked Al-Jamajim.
narrators_ar: قَبِيصَةُ، سُفْيَانُ، مَنْصُورٍ، إِبْرَاهِيمَ، خَيْثَمَةَ
narrators_en: Qabisa, Sufyan, Mansur, Ibrahim, Khaythama

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا وَكِيعٌ عَنْ سُفْيَانَ، عَنْ يَزِيدَ، عَنْ أَبِي الْبَخْتَرِيِّ، أَنَّهُ رَأَى رَجُلًا مُنْهَزِمًا أَيَّامَ الْجَمَاجِمِ فَقَالَ: حَرُّ النَّارِ أَشَدُّ مِنْ حَرِّ السَّيْفِ
english_text: Waki' told us, from Sufyan, from Yazid, from Abu al-Bakhtari, that he saw a man fleeing during the Days of al-Jamajim, so he said: "The heat of the Fire is more severe than the heat of the sword."
narrators_ar: وَكِيعٌ، سُفْيَانَ، يَزِيدَ، أَبِي الْبَخْتَرِيِّ
narrators_en: Waki', Sufyan, Yazid, Abu al-Bakhtari

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا قَبِيصَةُ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، عَنْ مَنْصُورٍ، عَنْ مُجَاهِدٍ، أَنَّهُ كَرِهَ الْجَمَاجِمَ
english_text: Qabisa told us, he said Sufyan told us, from Mansur, from Mujahid, that he disliked Al-Jamajim.
narrators_ar: قَبِيصَةُ، سُفْيَانُ، مَنْصُورٍ، مُجَاهِدٍ
narrators_en: Qabisa, Sufyan, Mansur, Mujahid

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا أَبُو أُسَامَةَ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا مُجَالِدٌ، قَالَ أَخْبَرَنَا عَامِرٌ، قَالَ أَخْبَرَتْنِي فَاطِمَةُ ابْنَةُ قَيْسٍ، قَالَتْ: خَرَجَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ ذَاتَ يَوْمٍ بِالْهَاجِرَةِ يُصَلِّي قَالَتْ: ثُمَّ صَعِدَ الْمِنْبَرَ فَقَامَ النَّاسُ فَقَالَ: "أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ , اجْلِسُوا فَإِنِّي لَمْ أَقُمْ مَقَامِي هَذَا لِرَغْبَةٍ وَلَا لِرَهْبَةٍ , وَذَلِكَ أَنَّهُ صَعِدَ الْمِنْبَرَ فِي السَّاعَةِ لَمْ يَكُنْ يَصْعَدُهُ فِيهَا , وَلَكِنَّ تَمِيمًا الدَّارِيَّ أَتَانِي فَأَخْبَرَنِي خَبَرًا مَنَعَنِي الْقَيْلُولَةَ مِنَ الْفَرَحِ وَقُرَّةِ الْعَيْنِ , فَأَحْبَبْتُ أَنْ أَنْشُرَ عَلَيْكُمْ خَبَرَ تَمِيمٍ , أَخْبَرَنِي أَنَّ رَهْطًا مِنْ بَنِي عَمِّهِ رَكِبُوا الْبَحْرَ فَأَصَابَتْهُمْ عَاصِفٌ مِنْ رِيحٍ , فَأَلْجَأَتْهُمْ إِلَى جَزِيرَةٍ لَا يَعْرِفُونَهَا فَقَعَدُوا فِي قَوَارِبِ السَّفِينَةِ حَتَّى خَرَجُوا إِلَى الْجَزِيرَةِ فَإِذَا هُمْ بِشَيْءٍ أَسْوَدَ أَهْدَبَ كَثِيرِ الشَّعْرِ , لَا يَدْرُونَ هُوَ رَجُلٌ أَوِ امْرَأَةٌ , قَالُوا: أَلَا تُخْبِرُنَا , قَالَ: مَا أَنَا بِمُخْبِرِكُمْ وَلَا مُسْتَخْبِرِكُمْ شَيْئًا , وَلَكِنَّ هَذَا الدَّيْرَ قَدْ رَمَقْتُمُوهُ فَفِيهِ مَنْ هُوَ إِلَى خَبَرِكُمْ بِالْأَشْوَاقِ , وَإِلَى أَنْ يُخْبِرَكُمْ وَيَسْتَخْبِرَكُمْ , قَالُوا: فَمَا أَنْتَ؟ قَالَتْ: أَنَا الْجَسَّاسَةُ ; فَانْطَلَقُوا حَتَّى أَتَوَا الدَّيْرَ فَاسْتَأْذَنُوا فَأَذِنَ لَهُمْ فَإِذَا هُمْ بِشَيْخٍ مُوثَقٍ شَدِيدِ الْوَثَاقِ مُظْهِرٍ الْحُزْنَ كَثِيرِ التَّشَكِّي , فَسَلَّمُوا عَلَيْهِ فَرَدَّ السَّلَامَ وَقَالَ: مِنْ أَيْنَ أَنْتُمْ؟ قَالُوا: مِنَ الشَّامِ , قَالَ: مِمَّنْ أَنْتُمْ؟ قَالُوا: مِنَ الْعَرَبِ , قَالَ: مَا فَعَلَتِ الْعَرَبُ , خَرَجَ نَبِيُّهُمْ بَعْدُ؟ قَالُوا: نَعَمْ قَالَ: فَمَا فَعَلُوا؟ قَالُوا: نَاوَأَهُ قَوْمٌ فَأَظْهَرَهُ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ فَهُمُ الْيَوْمَ جَمِيعٌ , قَالَ: ذَاكَ خَيْرٌ وَذَكَرَ فِيهِ: آمَنُوا بِهِ وَاتَّبَعُوهُ وَصَدَّقُوهُ , قَالَ ذَاكَ خَيْرٌ لَهُمْ , قَالَ: فَالْعَرَبُ الْيَوْمَ إِلَهُهُمْ وَاحِدٌ وَكَلِمَتُهُمْ وَاحِدَةٌ؟ قَالُوا: نَعَمْ , قَالَ: ذَاكَ خَيْرٌ لَهُمْ , قَالَ: فَمَا فَعَلَتْ عَيْنُ زُغَرَ؟ قَالُوا: صَالِحَةٌ يَشْرَبُ أَهْلُهَا بِشَفَتِهِمْ وَيَسْقُونَ مِنْهَا زَرْعَهُمْ قَالَ: فَمَا فَعَلَ نَخْلٌ بَيْنَ عَمَّانَ وَبَيْسَانَ؟ قَالُوا: يُطْعِمُ جَنَاهُ كُلَّ عَامٍ قَالَ: فَمَا فَعَلَتْ بُحَيْرَةُ الطَّبَرِيَّةِ؟ قَالُوا: مَلْأَى تَدَفَّقُ جَنَبَاتُهَا مِنْ كَثْرَةِ الْمَاءِ , قَالَ فَزَفَرَ ثُمَّ زَفَرَ ثُمَّ زَفَرَ ثُمَّ حَلَفَ فَقَالَ: لَوْ قَدِ انْفَلَتُّ أَوْ خَرَجْتُ مِنْ وَثَاقِي هَذَا أَوْ مَكَانِي هَذَا مَا تَرَكْتُ أَرْضًا إِلَّا وَطِئْتُهَا بِرِجْلِي هَاتَيْنِ غَيْرَ طَيْبَةَ , لَيْسَ لِي عَلَيْهَا سَبِيلٌ وَلَا سُلْطَانٌ , فَقَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: إِلَى هَذَا انْتَهَى فَرَحِي , هَذِهِ طَيْبَةُ , وَالَّذِي نَفْسُ مُحَمَّدٍ بِيَدِهِ , إِنَّ هَذِهِ طَيْبَةُ , وَلَقَدْ حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ حَرَمِي عَلَى الدَّجَّالِ أَنْ يَدْخُلَهُ , ثُمَّ حَلَفَ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ: مَا لَهَا طَرِيقٌ ضَيِّقٌ وَلَا وَاسِعٌ فِي سَهْلٍ أَوْ جَبَلٍ إِلَّا عَلَيْهِ مَلَكٌ شَاهِرٌ بِالسَّيْفِ إِلَى يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ , مَا يَسْتَطِيعُ الدَّجَّالُ أَنْ يَدْخُلَهَا عَلَى أَهْلِهَا , قَالَ مُجَالِدٌ: فَأَخْبَرَنِي عَامِرٌ قَالَ: ذَكَرْتُ هَذَا الْحَدِيثَ لِلْقَاسِمِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ فَقَالَ الْقَاسِمُ: أَشْهَدُ عَلَى عَائِشَةَ لَحَدَّثَتْنِي هَذَا الْحَدِيثَ غَيْرَ أَنَّهَا قَالَتِ: الْحَرَمَانِ عَلَيْهِ حَرَامٌ: مَكَّةُ وَالْمَدِينَةُ , قَالَ عَامِرٌ: فَلَقِيتُ الْمُحَرَّرَ بْنَ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ فَحَدَّثْتُهُ حَدِيثَ عَائِشَةَ فَقَالَ: أَشْهَدُ عَلَى أَبِي أَنَّهُ حَدَّثَنِي كَمَا حَدَّثَتْكَ عَائِشَةُ مَا نَقَصَ حَرْفًا وَاحِدًا غَيْرَ أَنَّ أَبِي قَدْ زَادَ فِيهِ بَابًا وَاحِدًا , قَالَ: فَحَطَّ النَّبِيُّ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ بِيَدِهِ نَحْوَ الْمَشْرِقِ قَرِيبًا مِنْ عِشْرِينَ مَرَّةً
english_text: Abu Usama told us, he said Mujalid told us, he said 'Amir informed us, he said Fatimah bint Qays informed me, she said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) went out one day during the midday heat to pray. She said: Then he ascended the pulpit, and the people stood up. He said: "O people, sit down, for I did not stand in this position of mine out of desire nor out of fear." And that was because he ascended the pulpit at a time he did not usually ascend it. "But Tamim al-Dari came to me and informed me of news that prevented me from napping out of joy and delight, so I loved to spread to you the news of Tamim. He informed me that a group of his cousins rode the sea, and a storm wind hit them, driving them to an island they did not know. They sat in the small boats of the ship until they came out onto the island. Suddenly, they encountered a black, shaggy thing with much hair; they did not know if it was a man or a woman. They said: 'Will you not inform us?' It said: 'I will not inform you nor ask you anything. But this monastery that you have sighted, in it is one who is eager for your news, and to inform you and ask you.' They said: 'Who are you?' She said: 'I am Al-Jassasah.' So they went until they came to the monastery, asked permission, and were permitted. Suddenly, they saw an old man, bound tightly, showing sadness and complaining much. They greeted him, and he returned the greeting and said: 'Where are you from?' They said: 'From Al-Sham.' He said: 'Who are you from?' They said: 'From the Arabs.' He said: 'What have the Arabs done? Has their Prophet emerged yet?' They said: 'Yes.' He said: 'So what did they do?' They said: 'A people opposed him, but Allah made him victorious over them, so today they are united.' He said: 'That is good,' and he mentioned regarding it: 'They believed in him, followed him, and affirmed him.' He said: 'That is good for them.' He said: 'So do the Arabs today have one God and one word?' They said: 'Yes.' He said: 'That is good for them.' He said: 'What has the spring of Zughar done?' They said: 'It is good; its people drink with their lips and irrigate their crops from it.' He said: 'What have the palms between 'Amman and Baisan done?' They said: 'They yield their harvest every year.' He said: 'What has the Lake of Tiberias done?' They said: 'It is full, its sides overflowing from the abundance of water.' He said: Then he sighed, then sighed, then sighed, then swore saying: 'If I were released or went out from these bonds of mine or this place of mine, I would not leave a land except that I would tread it with these two feet of mine, except Taybah; I have no way nor authority over it.' The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: 'To this my joy has reached. This is Taybah. By the One in Whose Hand is the soul of Muhammad, indeed this is Taybah. And Allah has forbidden the Dajjal from entering my sanctuary.'" Then he (peace be upon him) swore: "It has no narrow path nor wide path in a plain or mountain except that there is an angel upon it with a drawn sword until the Day of Resurrection; the Dajjal will not be able to enter it upon its people." Mujalid said: 'Amir informed me, saying: I mentioned this Hadith to Al-Qasim bin Muhammad, and Al-Qasim said: "I testify regarding Aisha that she narrated this Hadith to me, except that she said: 'The two sanctuaries are forbidden to him: Mecca and Medina.'" 'Amir said: So I met Al-Muharrir bin Abi Huraira and told him the Hadith of Aisha, and he said: "I testify regarding my father that he told me just as Aisha told you, he did not subtract a single letter, except that my father added one chapter to it. He said: The Prophet (peace be upon him) gestured with his hand towards the East close to twenty times."
narrators_ar: أَبُو أُسَامَةَ، مُجَالِدٌ، عَامِرٌ، فَاطِمَةُ ابْنَةُ قَيْسٍ، تَمِيمًا الدَّارِيَّ، الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ، عَائِشَةَ، الْمُحَرَّرَ بْنَ أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ، أَبِي هُرَيْرَةَ
narrators_en: Abu Usama, Mujalid, 'Amir, Fatimah bint Qays, Tamim al-Dari, Al-Qasim b. Muhammad, Aisha, Al-Muharrir b. Abi Huraira, Abu Huraira

arabic_text: حَدَّثَنَا عَبْدُ اللَّهِ بْنُ نُمَيْرٍ قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا سُفْيَانُ، قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا سَلَمَةُ بْنُ كُهَيْلٍ، عَنْ أَبِي الزَّعْرَاءِ، عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ، أَنَّهُ ذُكِرَ عِنْدَهُ الدَّجَّالَ فَقَالَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ: "تَفْتَرِقُونَ أَيُّهَا النَّاسُ لِخُرُوجِهِ ثَلَاثَ فِرَقٍ: فِرْقَةٌ تَتْبَعُهُ , وَفِرْقَةٌ تَلْحَقُ بِأَرْضِ آبَائِهَا بِمَنَابِتِ الشِّيحِ , وَفِرْقَةٌ تَأْخُذُ شَطَّ هَذَا الْفُرَاتِ فَيُقَاتِلُهُمْ وَيُقَاتِلُونَهُ حَتَّى يَجْتَمِعَ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ بِقُرَى الشَّامِ فَيَبْعَثُونَ إِلَيْهِ طَلِيعَةً فِيهِمْ فَارِسٌ عَلَى فَرَسٍ أَشْقَرَ أَوْ فَرَسٍ أَبْلَقَ , فَيُقْتَلُونَ لَا يَرْجِعُ مِنْهُمْ بَشَرٌ ; قَالَ سَلَمَةُ: فَحَدَّثَنِي أَبُو صَادِقٍ عَنْ رَبِيعَةَ بْنِ نَاجِدٍ أَنَّ عَبْدَ اللَّهِ قَالَ: فَرَسٌ أَشْقَرُ , ثُمَّ قَالَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ: وَيَزْعُمُ أَهْلُ الْكِتَابِ أَنَّ الْمَسِيحَ عِيسَى ابْنَ مَرْيَمَ يَنْزِلُ فَيَقْتُلُهُ , قَالَ أَبُو الزَّعْرَاءِ: مَا سَمِعْتُ عَبْدَ اللَّهِ يَذْكُرُ عَنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ حَدِيثًا غَيْرَ هَذَا , قَالَ: ثُمَّ يَخْرُجُ يَأْجُوجُ وَمَأْجُوجُ فَيَمْرَحُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ فَيُفْسِدُونَ فِيهَا , ثُمَّ قَرَأَ وَهُمْ مِنْ كُلِّ حَدَبٍ يَنْسِلُونَ قَالَ: ثُمَّ يَبْعَثُ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ دَابَّةً مِثْلَ هَذَا النَّغَفِ فَتَلِجُ فِي أَسْمَاعِهِمْ وَمَنَاخِرِهِمْ فَيَمُوتُونَ مِنْهَا , قَالَ: فَتَنْتُنُ الْأَرْضُ مِنْهُمْ فَيُجَارُ إِلَى اللَّهِ فَيُرْسِلُ عَلَيْهِمْ مَاءً فَيُطَهِّرُ الْأَرْضَ مِنْهُمْ , ثُمَّ قَالَ: يُرْسِلُ اللَّهُ رِيحًا زَمْهَرِيرًا بَارِدَةً , فَلَا تَذَرُ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ مُؤْمِنًا إِلَّا كَفَتْهُ تِلْكَ الرِّيحَ , قَالَ: ثُمَّ تَقُومُ السَّاعَةُ عَلَى شِرَارِ النَّاسِ , قَالَ: ثُمَّ يَقُومُ مَلَكٌ بَيْنَ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ بِالصُّورِ فَيَنْفُخُ فِيهِ , قَالَ: وَالصُّورُ قَرْنٌ , قَالَ: فَلَا يَبْقَى خَلْقُ اللَّهِ فِي السَّمَاءِ وَلَا فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا مَاتَ إِلَّا مَا شَاءَ رَبُّكَ , قَالَ: ثُمَّ يَكُونُ بَيْنَ النَّفْخَتَيْنِ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ أَنْ يَكُونَ , قَالَ: فَيَرُشُّ اللَّهُ مَاءً مِنْ تَحْتِ الْعَرْشِ كَمَنِيِّ الرِّجَالِ قَالَ: فَلَيْسَ مِنَ ابْنِ آدَمَ خَلْقٌ إِلَّا فِي الْأَرْضِ مِنْهُ شَيْءٌ قَالَ: فَتَنْبُتُ أَجْسَادُهُمْ وَلِحْمَانُهُمْ مِنْ ذَلِكَ الْمَاءِ كَمَنَابِتِ الْأَرْضِ مِنَ الثَّرَى ثُمَّ قَرَأَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ {وَاللَّهُ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ الرِّيَاحَ فَتُثِيرُ سَحَابًا فَسُقْنَاهُ إِلَى بَلَدٍ مَيِّتٍ فَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِ الْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا كَذَلِكَ النُّشُورُ} قَالَ: ثُمَّ يَقُومُ مَلَكٌ بَيْنَ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ بِالصُّورِ فَيَنْفُخُ فِيهِ , قَالَ: فَتَنْطَلِقُ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ إِلَى جَسَدِهَا فَتَدْخُلُ فِيهِ , قَالَ: ثُمَّ يَقُومُونَ فَيُحَيُّونَ تَحِيَّةَ رَجُلٍ وَاحِدٍ قِيَامًا لِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ , ثُمَّ يَتَمَثَّلُ اللَّهُ لِلْخَلْقِ فَيَلْقَاهُمْ فَلَيْسَ أَحَدٌ مِنَ الْخَلْقِ مِمَّنْ يَعْبُدُ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا إِلَّا وَهُوَ مَرْفُوعٌ لَهُ يَتْبَعُهُ فَيَلْقَى الْيَهُودَ فَيَقُولُ: مَنْ تَعْبُدُونَ؟ فَيَقُولُونَ: نَعْبُدُ عُزَيْرًا , فَيَقُولُ: هَلْ يَسُرُّكُمُ الْمَاءُ؟ قَالُوا: نَعَمْ , قَالَ: فَيُرِيهِمْ جَهَنَّمَ وَهِيَ كَهَيْئَةِ السَّرَابِ , ثُمَّ قَرَأَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ {وَعَرَضْنَا جَهَنَّمَ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْكَافِرِينَ عَرْضًا} ثُمَّ يَلْقَى النَّصَارَى فَيَقُولُ: مَنْ تَعْبُدُونَ؟ قَالُوا: نَعْبُدُ الْمَسِيحَ , قَالَ: يَقُولُ: هَلْ يَسُرُّكُمُ الْمَاءُ؟ قَالُوا: نَعَمْ , فَيُرِيهِمْ جَهَنَّمَ وَهِيَ كَهَيْئَةِ السَّرَابِ ; قَالَ: ثُمَّ كَذَلِكَ لِمَنْ كَانَ يَعْبُدُ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا , ثُمَّ قَرَأَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ وَقِفُوهُمْ إِنَّهُمْ مَسْئُولُونَ حَتَّى يَمُرَّ الْمُسْلِمُونَ فَيَقُولُ: مَنْ تَعْبُدُونَ؟ فَيَقُولُونَ: نَعْبُدُ اللَّهَ وَلَا نُشْرِكُ بِهِ شَيْئًا ; قَالَ: فَيَقُولُ: هَلْ تَعْرِفُونَ رَبَّكُمْ؟ فَيَقُولُونَ: سُبْحَانَهُ , إِذَا تَعَرَّفَ لَنَا عَرَفْنَاهُ , قَالَ: فَعِنْدَ ذَلِكَ يُكْشَفُ عَنْ سَاقٍ فَلَا يَبْقَى أَحَدٌ إِلَّا خَرَّ لِلَّهِ سَاجِدًا , وَيَبْقَى الْمُنَافِقُونَ ظُهُورُهُمْ طَبَقٌ وَاحِدٌ ; كَأَنَّمَا فِيهَا السَّفَافِيدُ , قَالَ: فَيَقُولُونَ: قَدْ كُنْتُمْ تُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى السُّجُودِ وَأَنْتُمْ سَالِمُونَ , وَيَأْمُرُ اللَّهُ بِالصِّرَاطِ فَيُضْرَبُ عَلَى جَهَنَّمَ , قَالَ: فَيَمُرُّ النَّاسُ زُمَرًا عَلَى قَدْرِ أَعْمَالِهِمْ , أَوَّلُهُمْ كَلَمْحِ الْبَرْقِ , ثُمَّ كَمَرِّ الرِّيحِ ثُمَّ كَمَرِّ الطَّيْرِ ثُمَّ كَأَسْرَعِ الْبَهَائِمِ ثُمَّ كَذَلِكَ حَتَّى يَمُرَّ الرَّجُلُ سَعْيًا , وَحَتَّى يَمُرَّ الرَّجُلُ مَاشِيًا , وَحَتَّى يَكُونَ آخِرُهُمْ رَجُلٌ يَتَلَبَّطُ عَلَى بَطْنِهِ , فَيَقُولُ , أَبْطَأْتَ بِي , فَيَقُولُ: لَمْ أُبْطِئْ , إِنَّمَا أَبْطَأَ بِكَ عَمَلُكَ , قَالَ: ثُمَّ يَأْذَنُ اللَّهُ بِالشَّفَاعَةِ فَيَكُونُ أَوَّلَ شَافِعٍ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ رُوحُ الْقُدُسِ جِبْرِيلُ , ثُمَّ إِبْرَاهِيمُ خَلِيلُ الرَّحْمَنِ , ثُمَّ مُوسَى أَوْ عِيسَى لَا أَدْرِي مُوسَى أَوْ عِيسَى , ثُمَّ يَقُومُ نَبِيُّكُمْ رَابِعًا لَا يَشْفَعُ أَحَدٌ بَعْدَهُ فِيمَا شَفَعَ فِيهِ , وَهُوَ الْمَقَامُ الْمَحْمُودُ الَّذِي ذَكَرَ اللَّهُ {عَسَى أَنْ يَبْعَثَكَ رَبُّكَ مَقَامًا مَحْمُودًا} فَلَيْسَ مِنْ نَفْسٍ إِلَّا تَنْظُرُ إِلَى بَيْتٍ مِنَ النَّارِ أَوْ بَيْتٍ فِي الْجَنَّةِ , وَهُوَ يَوْمُ الْحَسْرَةِ , فَيَرَى أَهْلُ النَّارِ الْبَيْتَ الَّذِي فِي الْجَنَّةِ فَيُقَالُ: لَوْ عَمِلْتُمْ فَتَأْخُذُكُمُ الْحَسْرَةُ وَيَرَى أَهْلُ الْجَنَّةِ الْبَيْتَ الَّذِي فِي النَّارِ فَيَقُولُونَ: لَوْلَا أَنْ مَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا لَخَسَفَ بِنَا قَالَ: ثُمَّ يَشْفَعُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَالنَّبِيُّونَ وَالشُّهَدَاءُ وَالصَّالِحُونَ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ , فَيُشَفِّعُهُمُ اللَّهُ , قَالَ: ثُمَّ يَقُولُ: أَنَا أَرْحَمُ الرَّاحِمِينَ , قَالَ: فَيُخْرِجُ مِنَ النَّارِ أَكْثَرَ مِمَّا أُخْرِجَ مِنْ جَمِيعِ الْخَلْقِ بِرَحْمَتِهِ حَتَّى مَا يَتْرُكُ فِيهَا أَحَدًا فِيهِ خَيْرٌ , ثُمَّ قَرَأَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ {مَا سَلَكَكُمْ فِي سَقَرَ} قَالَ: وَجَعَلَ يَعْقِدُ حَتَّى عَدَّ أَرْبَعًا , {قَالُوا لَمْ نَكُ مِنَ الْمُصَلِّينَ وَلَمْ نَكُ نُطْعِمُ الْمِسْكِينَ وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ الْخَائِضِينَ وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوْمِ الدِّينِ حَتَّى أَتَانَا الْيَقِينُ فَمَا تَنْفَعُهُمْ شَفَاعَةُ الشَّافِعِينَ} ثُمَّ قَالَ عَبْدُ اللَّهِ: أَتَرَوْنَ فِي هَؤُلَاءِ خَيْرًا , مَا يُتْرَكُ فِيهَا أَحَدٌ فِيهِ خَيْرٌ , فَإِذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ , أَنْ لَا يُخْرِجَ مِنْهَا أَحَدًا غَيَّرَ وُجُوهَهُمْ وَأَلْوَانَهُمْ فَيَجِيءُ الرَّجُلُ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ فَيَقُولُ: يَا رَبِّ , فَيَقُولُ: مَنْ عَرَفَ أَحَدًا فَلْيُخْرِجْهُ , قَالَ: فَيَجِيءُ فَيَنْظُرُ فَلَا يَعْرِفُ أَحَدًا , قَالَ: فَيُنَادِيهِ الرَّجُلُ: يَا فُلَانُ , أَنَا فُلَانٌ , فَيَقُولُ مَا أَعْرِفُكَ , قَالَ: فَعِنْدَ ذَلِكَ يَقُولُونَ: {رَبَّنَا أَخْرِجْنَا مِنْهَا فَإِنْ عُدْنَا فَإِنَّا ظَالِمُونَ} قَالَ: فَيَقُولُ عِنْدَ ذَلِكَ: {اخْسَئُوا فِيهَا وَلَا تُكَلِّمُونَ} قَالَ فَإِذَا قَالَ ذَلِكَ أُطْبِقَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ فَلَا يَخْرُجُ مِنْهُمْ بَشَرٌ
english_text: 'Abd Allah bin Numayr told us, he said Sufyan told us, he said Salama bin Kuhayl told us, from Abu al-Za'ra', from 'Abd Allah, that the Dajjal was mentioned in his presence, so 'Abd Allah said: "You will divide, O people, upon his emergence into three groups: a group that follows him; a group that returns to the land of their fathers where wormwood grows; and a group that takes the bank of this Euphrates, fighting them and being fought by him until the believers gather in the villages of Al-Sham. They will send a reconnaissance party to him, among whom is a rider on a blond horse or a piebald horse; they will be killed, not a human among them will return." Salama said: Abu Sadiq narrated to me from Rabi'a bin Najidh that 'Abd Allah said: "A blond horse." Then 'Abd Allah said: "And the People of the Book claim that the Messiah, Jesus son of Mary, will descend and kill him." Abu al-Za'ra' said: I never heard 'Abd Allah mention a Hadith from the People of the Book other than this. He said: "Then Gog and Magog will emerge, rushing exultantly in the earth and causing corruption in it." Then he recited {And they from every elevation descend}. He said: "Then Allah will send upon them a creature like this naghaf (worm) which will enter their ears and noses, and they will die from it." He said: "The earth will stink from them, so help will be sought from Allah, and He will send water upon them which will cleanse the earth of them." Then he said: "Allah will send a bitterly cold wind (Zamharir), leaving no believer on earth except that that wind will take him." He said: "Then the Hour will be established upon the worst of people." He said: "Then an angel will stand between the heaven and the earth with the Horn (Sur) and blow into it." He said: "And the Sur is a horn." He said: "So no creation of Allah will remain in the heaven or the earth except that it dies, except whom your Lord wills." He said: "Then there will be between the two blowings whatever Allah wills there to be." He said: "Then Allah will sprinkle water from beneath the Throne like the semen of men." He said: "There is no creation of the son of Adam except that a part of him is in the earth." He said: "So their bodies and flesh will grow from that water like the vegetation of the earth grows from the moisture." Then 'Abd Allah recited {And it is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and give life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection.} [Fatir: 9]. He said: "Then an angel will stand between the heaven and the earth with the Horn and blow into it." He said: "So every soul will proceed to its body and enter it." He said: "Then they will stand up, greeting with the greeting of one man, standing for the Lord of the worlds. Then Allah will manifest Himself to the creation and meet them. There is no one from the creation who worshipped anything besides Allah except that it will be raised for him and he will follow it. He will meet the Jews and say: 'Who do you worship?' They will say: 'We worship Uzair.' He will say: 'Would water please you?' They will say: 'Yes.' He said: So He will show them Hellfire appearing like a mirage." Then 'Abd Allah recited {And We will present Hell that Day to the disbelievers, on display} [Al-Kahf: 100]. "Then He will meet the Christians and say: 'Who do you worship?' They will say: 'We worship the Messiah.' He will say: 'Would water please you?' They will say: 'Yes.' So He will show them Hellfire appearing like a mirage." He said: "Then likewise for whoever worshipped anything besides Allah." Then 'Abd Allah recited {And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned}. "Until the Muslims pass, and He will say: 'Who do you worship?' They will say: 'We worship Allah and do not associate anything with Him.' He said: So He will say: 'Do you know your Lord?' They will say: 'Glory be to Him! If He makes Himself known to us, we will know Him.' He said: So at that, the Shin will be uncovered, and no one will remain except that he falls prostrate to Allah. The hypocrites will remain, their backs like a single plate (stiff), as if there are skewers in them." He said: "They will say: {You used to be invited to prostrate while you were sound}." "And Allah will order the Bridge (Sirat), and it will be set over Hell." He said: "People will pass in groups according to their deeds. The first of them like the flash of lightning, then like the passing of wind, then like the passing of birds, then like the fastest of animals, then likewise until a man passes running, and until a man passes walking, and until the last of them will be a man crawling on his belly. He will say: 'You made me slow.' He will say: 'I did not make you slow; rather, your deeds made you slow.' He said: Then Allah will permit intercession. The first intercessor on the Day of Resurrection will be the Spirit of Holiness, Gabriel, then Ibrahim the Friend of the Merciful, then Moses or Jesus—I do not know Moses or Jesus—then your Prophet will stand fourth; no one will intercede after him in what he interceded in. That is the Praiseworthy Station (Maqam Mahmud) which Allah mentioned: {It may be that your Lord will raise you to a Praiseworthy Station} [Al-Isra: 79]. There is no soul but that it looks at a house in the Fire or a house in Paradise. That is the Day of Regret. The people of the Fire will see the house in Paradise and it will be said: 'If only you had worked,' so regret will seize them. And the people of Paradise will see the house in the Fire and say: 'Had Allah not favored us, He would have caused the earth to swallow us.' He said: Then the angels, prophets, martyrs, righteous, and believers will intercede, and Allah will accept their intercession. He said: Then He will say: 'I am the Most Merciful of the merciful.'
